programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45.(n)

programme.title: The Andrew Marr Show
programme.desc: A round-up of the week's stories, featuring interviews with key figures in politics and current affairs and a round-up of the Sunday papers. Including news and weather at 9.00.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Emma Barnett present topical debate covering religious, moral and ethical issues, with guest panellists and contributions from viewers.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Politics London
programme.desc: The week's events at Westminster, presented by Andrew Neil. Including news and a regional round-up.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Nick Hall and Natasha Raskin lend their expertise to two teams at Norfolk Antiques Fair, while presenter Thomas Plant learns how Norfolk schoolchildren went on strike in 1914.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker and guests look ahead to the men's singles final at the All England Club, as Marin Cilic and Roger Federer look to succeed 2016 champion Andy Murray on Centre Court.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Marin Cilic v Roger Federer. Sue Barker presents coverage of the men's singles final on Centre Court at SW19. Croatian Cilic has reached only his second Grand Slam final, having previously appeared in - and won - the showpiece match at the 2014 US Open. Legendary Swiss player Federer is looking for a record eighth triumph at Wimbledon, and 19th Major overall. Home favourite Andy Murray picked up his second Wimbledon title here in 2016, defeating Canada's sixth seed Milos Raonic 6-4, 7-6, 7-6 to claim his third major title overall, following his famous triumph here over Novak Djokovic in 2013 and the 2012 US Open, when he defeated the same player in the final. The Scot is currently world number one and came into this tournament as top seed, so hopes were high a fortnight ago for another strong run at his home event.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Ellie Harrison visits a Scottish island that is home to the largest puffin colony on Britain's east coast, and Sean Fletcher investigates the history of fruit growing in Fife. Plus, Tom Heap reports on the spread of bovine TB among goats and Adam Henson joins a member of Ordnance Survey as he maps field margins.(n)

programme.title: Fake or Fortune
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and art experts Philip Mould and Bendor Grosvenor come to the aid of a man who has inherited three paintings that he believes were painted by LS Lowry. However, he cannot prove whether they are the genuine article, and since Lowry is the British artist whose work is most frequently forged, it will take a great deal of evidence to convince the art establishment of their value. The search for the truth leads to a discovery that challenges established beliefs about the artist's life.(n)

programme.title: Poldark
programme.desc: Ross gives some of Nampara's land to the peasants so that they can provide for themselves, while he and Demelza also come to the aid of Dwight, who is terribly traumatised by his experiences of imprisonment in France. George tries to force Morwenna into marriage to further his political ambitions - an arrangement that Geoffrey unwittingly lets slip to Drake.(n)

programme.title: Would I Lie to You
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by space scientist Maggie Aderin-Pocock, comedian Phil Wang, actor Jason Watkins and EastEnders star Adam Woodyatt, aiming to deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon.(n)

programme.title: The Week the Landlords Moved In
programme.desc: Birmingham landlord Samuel is just 25 but already has a portfolio of 13 properties worth more than £1million in total, and lives off the combined rental income with his wife Amanda. The couple spend a week living in one of their houses, rented by mother-of-two Marie, to experience life from her perspective. Also taking part are husband-and-wife duo Paul and Sharon from Weston-super-Mare, Somerset, who move into a two-bedroom flat rented by Chris and Courtney. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Right on the Money
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood and Denise Lewis help an 81-year-old woman struggling to juggle the family finances while caring for her husband, who is suffering from dementia.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore properties sold at auction, including a three-bedroom house in Streatham, south London, which was bought by a recently married couple.(n)

programme.title: Neighbourhood Blues
programme.desc: Rob McIvor investigates after art galleries in Bath are inundated with Nazi-themed hate mail, and police in Bridgwater carry out an early morning raid in a quiet residential street.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville report on the cleanliness of British hotel rooms, while travel expert Simon Calder has money-saving tips for visiting America.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents from Newark, with experts Charles Hanson and Philip Serrell, while Charlie pops into town and pays a visit to the Civil War centre.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: New series. A killer is still at large, but the investigators lack leads, the Kielys mark the anniversary of Darren's death and Claire is unaware of the danger an intruder poses.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson heads to the Welsh borders to help a couple who want their £750,000 budget to provide them a country home with potential to become a B&B business. The presenter also discovers how the region's iron works heritage is being recast into unique super-sized sculptures.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: At the tip, Sarah Moore prevents a sewage pipe, a blanket box and a cardboard box full of old plates from being dumped to landfill, transforming them into bespoke and valuable pieces. Back in Stockport, she reveals the transformations and hands over the profits to the people who had no idea that riches could be made from their rubbish.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: People are invited to try to make money out of their antiques by taking a risk at auction.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys puts another selection of famous faces through their general-knowledge paces. Taking a seat in the black chair are CBBC's Lauren Layfield, who answers questions on the Jurassic Park films, broadcaster and journalist David Aaronovitch, who tackles Radio 4 soap The Archers, BBC Breakfast's Tim Muffett demonstrates his knowledge of the Films of Danny Boyle trivia, and Paralympic gold medallist Kadeena Cox faces questions about Arsenal FC.(n)

programme.title: True North
programme.desc: The Donnelly family from rural County Armagh are thought to be the oldest group of siblings in the world. Collectively their ages add up to 1,064 years. Angela Scanlon meets them as they attempt to get a world record. Part of BBC One's Our Lives strand.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Steven avoids Lauren's obvious concerns following his shocking news and assures her everything will be fine - but when Abi learns about his lie she warns him to tell the truth. Ian celebrates accepting an offer on the fish-and-chip shop, although his excitement fades when he realises who bought it. Sonia is surprised to hear Dot is coming home despite the doctor's advice, while Alexandra and Keegan plan to cause havoc at the prom.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Donald Trump fought the US presidential election with a promise to send millions of illegal immigrants back to Mexico, and this programme investigates how his controversial deportation plans are being put into action. Reporter Hilary Andersson meets families split by immigration arrests as well as children of detained parents left to fend for themselves, and accompanies police in Arizona as they hunt down illegals at night.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Swansea.
programme.desc: Nick Knowles travels to Swansea to meet 15-year-old Jack, who suffers from a rare form of muscular dystrophy that has led to a lifetime of painful operations. His mother Helen and older brother Daniel do all they can to help but as he grows it has become impossible to get him upstairs and now he has to sleep in the living room, leaving the rest of the family with nowhere to socialise. Having heard of their plight, the DIY SOS team turns up to transform their three-bedroom semi, backed up by an army of local tradespeople, with designer Gabrielle Blackman on hand to ensure they don't stray too far from her vision.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Comedy Shuffle
programme.desc: The comedian, actor, writer and director looks back on his eventful career, shining a light on dieting. Plus, Car Share's John and Kayleigh are both in tears, and there's a special appearance by veteran snooker player Dennis Taylor.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News For You.
programme.desc: Actor Stephen Mangan hosts an extended edition of the satirical current affairs quiz, with Scottish Convervatives leader Ruth Davidson MSP and comedian Henning Wehn joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's news.(n)

programme.title: A to Z of TV Gardening
programme.desc: Carol Kirkwood looks at subjects beginning with the letter V, continuing her alphabetical journey through the world of horticulture. Along the way, she gets inspiration and advice from some of the BBC's most popular gardening presenters.(n)

programme.title: The Instant Gardener
programme.desc: Helen Skelton and Danny Clarke transform a dank Victorian garden in Sunderland into an inviting space for the owner's grandchildren.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don gives advice on how to prune summer flowering shrubs, makes plans for autumn flowers and returns to Dublin to find out how Helen Dillon is progressing in her new garden. Joe Swift shows how good design should not hinder challenging conditions when he visits a garden in Kent, Rachel de Thame explores the vital role of scent in wild flowers and the insects that visit them, and Nick Bailey prepares designs for a weekend project that will transform a front garden into a beautiful and practical space. Including Weather.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Anita Rani visits a groundbreaking project in Northamptonshire to incorporate wildlife conservation into a retail park. John Craven visits a micro-tannery and goes in search of an elusive butterfly, Adam Henson finds out about an insect farm in Cumbria, and Tom Heap reports on homelessness in rural areas.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents highlights of the series, recalling his favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Coverage of the men's wheelchair singles and ladies' wheelchair doubles finals, on the closing day of action at the third Grand Slam tournament of the year.(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater: Eating Together
programme.desc: Nigel focuses on dishes that bring people together, heading to Trowbridge in Wiltshire to discover what draws Moroccan families around a traditional lamb tagine. He also gets a lesson in the art of pairing spices for an Indonesian fish dish and meets Zoe, who shows him how to make Ghanaian jollof rice. Inspired by their recipes, Nigel creates a Sunday roast of pork belly and shredded duck with spiced flatbread.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers continue their culinary journey through time by celebrating Britain's numerous food festivals. The duo reveal the fascinating stories behind the events and sample some of the dishes on offer.(n)

programme.title: Father of the Bride Part II
programme.desc: A put-upon father has just got used to his daughter being married, when he learns she is pregnant. Thrown into a mid-life crisis, he impulsively sells his house so he and his wife can buy the seafront retreat they had always dreamed about - only for responsibility to come crashing back on him when his wife reveals she is also expecting. Comedy sequel, starring Steve Martin and Diane Keaton.(n)

programme.title: Wanted Down Under
programme.desc: Emma Turley and Ceri Wilson have a pleasant enough life in Manchester, but Emma has recently had a growing feeling that New Zealand could offer the couple more. Ceri is on board with the idea, but thinks a move could be a big gamble, and a week in Auckland shows the couple the grass is not always greener on the other side. However, it remains to be seen whether they will decide to follow their hearts and relocate Down Under. Presented by Nicki Chapman.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Meerkats: Secrets of an Animal Superstar.
programme.desc: Meerkat pups Squirt and Weeny belong to one of the most famous animal families on the planet and are also part of a 20-year animal behaviour study. David Attenborough narrates the full story of the research, from the early days when it was a challenge to even get close to a meerkat to the latest revelations about these animals and their complex lives.(n)

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Aled Jones and Mike Peters from the Alarm join a charity walk in the Welsh hills for NHS cancer services, while Kate Bottley meets a royal composer at St Asaph Cathedral.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Anita Manning and Mark Stacey help two teams to look for bargains at the RAF Museum in Hendon, London, while Paul Martin visits an exhibition of First World War flying pioneers.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker presents coverage of the mixed doubles final at the All England Club, as 2016 champions Henri Kontinen and Heather Watson face Jamie Murray and Martina Hingis. Finnish player Kontinen and home favourite Watson caused one of the fairytale stories of last year's event, defeating defending champions Hingis and Leander Paes in the third round and eventually overcoming Robert Farah and Anna-Lena Groenefeld 7-6, 6-4 in the final.(n)

programme.title: The Lone Ranger
programme.desc: A lawyer is left for dead after an ambush in which his Texas ranger brother is killed, but is saved by a mysterious Native American fugitive. Concealing his identity behind a mask, he and his new ally hunt down the outlaws behind the attack - only to find their actions are just part of a larger evil scheme. Western, starring Armie Hammer, Johnny Depp and Helena Bonham Carter. Edited for daytime broadcast.(n)

programme.title: Today at Wimbledon
programme.desc: Clare Balding and guests look back at highlights of the men's singles final, where the third Grand Slam title of the year was set to be decided. Plus, news from the rest of the day's finals as the famous tournament was brought to a conclusion, and a review of this year's staging of the event.(n)

programme.title: Golf: Scottish Open
programme.desc: Eilidh Barbour presents highlights of the final round of the European Tour event at Dundonald Links in Troon, Ayrshire, where Alexander Noren entered as the defending champion.(n)

programme.title: Athletics
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents action from the 10th Diamond League event of the season, held at Prince Moulay Abdellah Stadium in Rabat, Morocco.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Anita Rani visits a groundbreaking project in Northamptonshire to incorporate wildlife conservation into a retail park. John Craven visits a micro-tannery and goes in search of an elusive butterfly, Adam Henson finds out about an insect farm in Cumbria, and Tom Heap reports on homelessness in rural areas.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Jac and Fran get the shock of their lives when someone from their past turns up at the hospital, while Raf is ribbed by Fletch, spotting that he likes Essie a bit more than he's letting on, and encourages him to give things another go. When Donna's old schoolmate is admitted, she soon realises how her life has been completely turned upside down, and she has to face her fears.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Entrepreneur Duncan Bannatyne joins host Brian Conley for a nostalgic look at the archive television shows that helped set him on the path to business success, with selections including Take Your Pick and Coronation Street.(n)

programme.title: Right on the Money
programme.desc: Denise Lewis and Dominic Littlewood help a hard-working nurse who has to rely on the bank of mum and dad, despite working full-time.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles is joined in York by experts Nick Hall and Jonathan Pratt. The reds and blue teams have the choice of two antique centres to buy three items to take to auction in Darlington. Eric also finds out about the city's long association with confectionery at its Castle Museum.(n)

programme.title: Alone with the In-Laws
programme.desc: Chris and Stacey from Bristol are getting married in the summer, and while planning for the big day is one thing, making a success of the years that follow is another. To help out, the Rev Kate Bottley comes up with an idea - they will spend a few days living alone with their respective in-laws-to-be, to find out what they can learn about each other from the people who raised them. After four days, will the couple still feel the same about trying the knot?.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and reports from correspondents around the country. Presented by Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Athletics
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents action from the 10th Diamond League event of the season, held at Prince Moulay Abdellah Stadium in Rabat, Morocco.(n)

programme.title: Triathlon
programme.desc: Action from the men's and women's races in the fifth round of the ITU World Triathlon Series, which took place in Hamburg, Germany.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of Our Living Planet
programme.desc: Chris Packham embarks on a quest to highlight some of the most diverse ecosystems on the planet. Along the way, he details the intricate - and often unexpected - connections between various species that thrive in symbiosis, and showcases the habitats that make life on Earth possible. He begins by exploring the web of life sustained by one of the mightiest trees in the Amazon, and the tiny rodent it relies upon for survival.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts Charles Hanson and Christina Trevanion set off on a trip around Britain seeking out bargains they hope will make a profit at auction. They begin their journey in Whaley Bridge, Derbyshire, before heading to an auction in Liverpool.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Letterbox
programme.desc: New series. Game show hosted by Mel Giedroyc, as pairs of contestants go head-to-head to crack a series of passwords, in an attempt to take home £2,500 in cash. As the teams solve the passwords, they win letters that will help them later in the game, giving them a better chance of cracking the final password which unlocks the Letterbox holding the cash prize. However, if they end up as the losing pair along the way, they'll have to surrender all the letters they've won to the winning pair - who will then go through to the semi-final eliminator round.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood's Big Continental Road Trip
programme.desc: The Bake Off judge takes a series of road trips across different countries in Europe, driving some of the most famous cars made in each nation he visits. The first episode comes from Italy, where Paul takes a six-day journey with a different car for each day, beginning in Rome where he is joined by Strictly Come Dancing's Bruno Tonioli.(n)

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: New series. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions once again as the academic quiz returns for its 24th series since the revival of the show in 1994. The opening match of the first round sees the University of Edinburgh and Ulster University battle it out for a place in the second stage of the contest.(n)

programme.title: Nadiya's British Food Adventure
programme.desc: New series. The Great British Bake Off 2015 champion Nadiya Hussain embarks on a culinary road trip around Britain, meeting with producers, farmers and fishermen across the country as she creates her own recipes inspired by their produce. In the first episode Nadiya begins her tour in the Home Counties, where she visits an asparagus farm in Oxford, before trying her hand at food smoking in Milton Keynes.(n)

programme.title: Ripper Street
programme.desc: With Reid locked in the cells of Leman Street and Jedediah Shine dead, Dove and his protege Drummond try to track down Long Susan and Jackson and bring them to justice. However, having finally retrieved their son Connor, Long Susan and Jackson prepare to leave London for good - but can they bring themselves to leave their friend Reid behind?.(n)

programme.title: Normal for Norfolk
programme.desc: New series. The continuing travails of farmer Desmond MacCarthy as he attempts to keep his 17th-century manor house afloat and stay on the right side of bankruptcy. Now, hundreds of thousands of pounds in debt and with his overdraft at its limit, Desmond must conjure up increasingly clever ways to make money if he's to survive. The Wiveton cafe is beginning to thrive, but profits are devoured by the maintenance of the house and gardens. Desmond, with the help of his loyal team, begins to promote the Edwardian wing of Wiveton Hall as a place to stay and takes a booking from an international yoga retreat.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: Over the past two years, the staff of the Natural History Museum has undertaken a super-sized challenge - to take down its famous cast of a dinosaur skeleton in the entrance hall and replace it with an equally impressive skeleton of a blue whale - the largest animal to have lived. This documentary follows the teams of conservators and engineers as they take apart the diplodocus - known to staff and visitors as Dippy - bone by bone, ready for a countrywide tour and then get the whale ready to go on display - all without closing the museum to the public. Narrated by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: Lucy Worsley: Mozart's London Odyssey
programme.desc: The broadcaster traces the forgotten story of the young Mozart's adventures in Georgian London. Arriving in 1764 as an eight year old boy, the city held the promise of unrivalled musical opportunity. But in telling the telling the tale of Mozart's strange and unexpected encounters, Lucy Worsley reveals how life wasn't easy for the little boy in a big city. She also reveals how his experiences in London inspired his achievements.(n)

programme.title: BBC Proms 2017
programme.desc: Daniel Barenboim conducts German orchestra Staatskappelle Berlin in a concert of music by English composers at the Royal Albert Hall, including Elgar's Second Symphony and the premiere of Deep Time, a new piece by Harrison Birtwistle. Introduced by Tom Service.(n)

programme.title: John Denver: Country Boy
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the private life and public legacy of singer-songwriter John Denver, America's original `country boy', who died in 1997. The programme features the accounts of those closest to him, revealing the man behind the music.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Horizon: Asteroids - The Good, the Bad and the Ugly.
programme.desc: Scientists and researchers analyse recent discoveries about asteroids, and how their studies suggest smaller rocks could pose a threat as they head toward Earth. The experts explain the photon propulsion that powers their journey across space and how some of these travellers carry a cargo of frost and ice that could have helped to start life on Earth.(n)

programme.title: Dissected
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary in which a team of anatomy experts, led by Dr George McGavin, dissects a real human hand - and uncovers why it is unique in the animal kingdom. They find out how hands provide power and precision, and talk to individuals who use theirs in extraordinary ways, including magicians and rock climbers.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Whale Hunters: The Untold Story
programme.desc: Adam Nicolson focuses on the controversial work of whale hunters as he tries to understand why the population of whales was so drastically reduced in the 20th century. In the first of two programmes, the writer discovers how whaling was commercialised to supply a growing demand for products such as corsets and oil-burning street lamps - before industrialisation took hold and the inventions of Norwegian Svend Foyn revolutionised the practice.(n)

programme.title: Atlantis - The Evidence
programme.desc: Historian Bettany Hughes presents a documentary unravelling the legend of Atlantis, which is considered one of the most intriguing mysteries of all time. She investigates evidence discovered by scientists that suggests it was inspired by one of the greatest natural disasters of the ancient world - a tsunami that hit Crete in 1500 BC.(n)

programme.title: Lucy Worsley: Mozart's London Odyssey
programme.desc: The broadcaster traces the forgotten story of the young Mozart's adventures in Georgian London. Arriving in 1764 as an eight year old boy, the city held the promise of unrivalled musical opportunity. But in telling the telling the tale of Mozart's strange and unexpected encounters, Lucy Worsley reveals how life wasn't easy for the little boy in a big city. She also reveals how his experiences in London inspired his achievements.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: Handmade: By Royal Appointment
programme.desc: In a small workshop in a country house in Wiltshire, silversmith Simon Benney makes distinctive jewellery and household objects for the royal family and private clients. Simon is following in the footsteps of his father, Gerald, who revolutionised the design of British silverware in the post-war era. This film follows the making of an engraved, gold and diamond pendant by Simon, featuring a trademark enamel finish using techniques his father learnt from Faberge.(n)

programme.title: Colour: The Spectrum of Science
programme.desc: Dr Helen Czerski tells the story of scientific endeavour, revealing the secrets of the universe as she takes to the skies in a jumbo jet, equipped with an infra-red telescope. She explores how the birds and the bees, who can see ultraviolet, view the world, and looks at how x-rays can be used to harness colours and image the human body as never before, thereby opening up new ways to treat disease. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Science and Islam
programme.desc: Professor Jim Al-Khalili reveals how Polish astronomer Nicolaus Copernicus's theories about the Earth's orbit were shaped by the discoveries of Islamic scientists. He travels to Syria to observe Ibn Al-Shatir's sundial on the minaret of the Umayyad Mosque in Damascus, before visiting one of the most influential observatories of the Islamic world, Maragheh designed by Al-Tusi. He ends his journey at the Royan Institute in Iran, to investigate how science is now regarded in Islam. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Storyville
programme.sub-title: Storyville: The Great European Cigarette Mystery.
programme.desc: An investigation into John Dalli, the former EU Commissioner of Health, who recently left his post having been accused of being in the pocket of the big tobacco companies. Two Danish journalists Mads Brugger and Mikael Bertelsen travel to Malta expecting to uncover proof of a vast conspiracy against Dalli, when a secret source steps forward, claiming to possess documents and recordings, taking them on a disturbing, thrilling and darkly humorous odyssey from the hallways of Brussels to an island in the Caribbean Sea.(n)

programme.title: Hidden Kingdoms
programme.desc: The documentary focuses on small creatures in an urban setting. In Rio de Janeiro, marmosets use power-lines as they would tree branches to scour the streets for food, and one animal becomes separated from its group and is forced to the ground, where it confronts the dangers of the city alone. Almost 11,000 miles away in the neon metropolis of Tokyo, a rhinoceros beetle begins an extraordinary journey to find sanctuary on a rare patch of greenery, along the way facing predatory bats, eight-eyed jumping spiders, praying mantises and a sharp-eyed crow. Including Hidden Kingdoms Revealed, showing how the film was made. Narrated by Stephen Fry. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Sabotage
programme.desc: David Ayer's Sabotage stars Arnold Schwarzenegger stars as Breacher, the veteran DEA agent in charge of a fearless squad. After effectively hiding 10 million in drug money during an epic bust, their plan falls apart when they return to discover that someone has swiped the cash. As the incident gets investigated, everyone is suspended from duty. After authorities fail to bring any charges, Breacher starts retraining the group which has grown rusty and distrustful of each other during the long layoff. Soon, members of Breacher's crew start dying in gruesome fashion. He gets close to Caroline Brentwood (Olivia Williams) the investigator put in charge of the case. Caroline eventually learns about a dark secret from Breacher's past. Soon the remaining members of the crew realize that one of them is responsible for the murders, and that same person probably has the cash as well(n)

programme.desc: Episode 305. Pitches include body jewelry, a movable basketball-training apparatus, an organic skin-care product and a "Rent-a-Grandma" business. Also: an update on a Season 1 barbecue restaurant(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 514. A woman tries to sell the Sharks on her special mud mask from Alaska. programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 503. Kevin and Robert team up against Mark; and two gorgeous women attempt to charm their way into an investment. programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 707. Twitter investor Chris Sacca appears as a guest on the panel. programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 727. Products include a motion-activated toilet light; an alternative to traditional beer; and interactive pet toys. programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 622. Also: an update on the Paint Brush Cover from Season 5(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles buys an expensive sweater, despite promising Daphne he would start saving for their child's college fund, and Frasier agrees to get Roz and Alice tickets to see a show by his ex-wife, which only serves to fan the embers of lust. Laurie Metcalf guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Live Formula 1

programme.desc: Steve Jones is joined by David Coulthard, Mark Webber, Eddie Jordan and Susie Wolff to preview the 10th round of the season, which takes place at Silverstone.(n)

programme.title: Live Formula 1
programme.desc: Coverage of the 10th round of the season (Start-time 1.00pm), which takes place at Silverstone. Mercedes driver and home favourite Lewis Hamilton has been victorious at this race for the past three years in succession, and the thousands in attendance will be hoping he can make it four in a row here, which would move him level with Jim Clark and Alain Prost as the joint most successful driver in the race's history with five wins overall. Presented by Steve Jones, with analysis from David Coulthard, Mark Webber, Eddie Jordan and Susie Wolff.(n)

programme.title: Live Formula 1
programme.sub-title: Formula 1 British Grand Prix Live Reaction: 2017.
programme.desc: Steve Jones is joined by David Coulthard, Mark Webber, Eddie Jordan and Susie Wolff to review the 10th round of the season, which took place at Silverstone.(n)

programme.title: World's Most Expensive Cars
programme.desc: A hearse previously owned by John Lennon is valued, while a Porsche that once belonged to Janis Joplin goes up for sale in New York. Presented by Ant Anstead.(n)

programme.title: The Restoration Man
programme.desc: George Clarke meets Cheshire couple Andrew Jones and Michele Gibbons, who are planning to turn an 85ft art deco water tower into a six-storey dream home. It proves an almighty challenge for the builders, who have to cut through double-reinforced concrete to build new floors and fit more than 20 new windows. However, as the contractors work on, the owners struggle to come to terms with their dislike of art deco furniture, realising they will need to furnish such a magnificent building in a fitting style.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.sub-title: World Para Athletics Championships London 2017: Day Three.
programme.desc: Arthur Williams, Sophie Morgan and Lee McKenzie present coverage of the evening session on day three of the Championships, which takes place at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park. Among the finals scheduled to take place tonight are the women's T42 100m and T35 200m, as well as the men's T13 and T44 100m, the T54 1500m, and the F35 shot put. With expert analysis from Stef Reid, Danny Crates, David Weir, and Liam Malone. Coverage continues on More4.(n)

programme.title: The Handmaid's Tale
programme.desc: The Commander takes Offred on a surprising adventure that introduces her to one of Gilead's best-kept secrets, and Nick's troubled past leads to his being recruited by the Sons of Jacob.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the words-and-numbers game, with Jon Richardson and Jonathan Ross taking on guest captain Lee Mack and Victoria Coren Mitchell. Jessie Cave joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner and Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: The Lincoln Lawyer
programme.desc: A cynical lawyer who operates out of his car takes on the profitable case of defending a rich man accused of rape. However, he begins to suspect his client may be guilty of not only this attack, but an earlier rape case for which another man is currently in prison. Thriller, starring Matthew McConaughey, Marisa Tomei, Ryan Phillippe and William H Macy.(n)

programme.title: The World's Weirdest Weather
programme.desc: Sunlight appears to transform water into liquid gold in California, a record-breaking heatwave wipes out thousands of bats in Australia, and weird weather makes sand dunes sing in the deserts of the Middle East. Plus, little-understood gravity waves captured on camera, how water can break apart rocks, why a lake in Canada is coming out in spots, and the unlucky tourist who visited the Grand Canyon, only to find the basin filled with thick fog.(n)

programme.title: The Last Leg
programme.desc: Adam Hills, Alex Brooker and Josh Widdicombe reflect on the highs and lows from the World Para Athletics Championships, currently taking place in London. The trio are joined by comedian Johnny Vegas, Paralympic double gold medallist Liam Malone and many other current and former participants.(n)

programme.title: KOTV Boxing Weekly
programme.desc: Gamal Yafai v Sean Davis. Highlights of the WBC International super-bantamweight title contest in Birmingham, plus action from an archive bout involving Rocky Marciano.(n)

programme.title: Gillette World Sport
programme.desc: Including action from the Superbikes World Championship, a profile of gliding world champion Luca Bertossio, and highlights of the Redbull X Fighters event in Madrid.(n)

programme.title: Mobil 1 The Grid
programme.desc: Including previews of the British Grand Prix and Brickyard 400, a look at why the Le Mans 24 Hour race is so popular in Denmark, and an interview with NASCAR driver Daniel Suarez.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer visit Hastings to help two couples look for their dream homes. However, with extravagant ideas and limited budgets on the agenda, they have their work cut out locating suitable properties. Jakki and Scott are determined to find a house before the arrival of their baby, while newlyweds Chris and Nicola want a two-bedroom family home in a great location.(n)

programme.title: 3rd Rock from the Sun
programme.desc: The four aliens land on Earth and assume human forms, and Dick soon finds himself attracted to a college professor with whom he shares an office. First-ever episode of the award-winning comedy, starring John Lithgow, Joseph Gordon-Levitt, Kristen Johnston and French Stewart.(n)

programme.title: 3rd Rock from the Sun
programme.desc: The aliens catch a cold from Tommy, just as Dick is about to escort Dr Albright to a wedding. Sci-fi comedy, guest starring Martha Stewart, with John Lithgow, Jane Curtin and Joseph Gordon-Levitt.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Will takes Karen to see one of the best doctors in the city after she misses her check-up, while Jack flirts with a male nurse - and the idea of becoming one himself. Guest starring Jack Black.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Karen lets Jack skip nursing school, and Grace returns to New York to celebrate her mother's birthday - to the delight of Will, who tries to persuade her to stay longer.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Frank has some anecdotes published in a magazine, sowing the seeds of grand writing ambitions. He approaches Ray's editor about becoming a columnist, but finds his way with words leaves a lot to be desired. Comedy, starring Peter Boyle.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Marie decides 40 years of marriage to Frank is enough for any woman and moves in with Ray - to the delight of Robert, who enjoys being mothered by her. Debra is unhappy with the situation and tries to persuade her father-in-law to apologise, but he is enjoying the single life too much to agree.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Martin suffers a mild heart attack, but tries to keep it from Ronee - to the dismay of Frasier and Niles, who feel it would be unfair of him to hide such serious news. Eventually worn down by their persistence, he decides to confide in her - leading to a conversation that ends in an unexpected way.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Infuriated at the dullness of his life, Frasier steals a small box from a neighbour for the thrill, but guilt prompts him to look for a way to return it without being caught - a task that proves easier said than done. With the guest voice of Helen Mirren.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles and Daphne plan a natural birth, causing the father-to-be to develop sympathy pains. Meanwhile, Frasier hires a professional matchmaker - but ends up going on a string of bad dates. Guest starring Laura Linney.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Shane Evans, COO and co-founder of massage therapy chain Massage Heights, poses as a contestant on a TV reality show who is trying fund her own business. After spending nine years moulding the company, she decides to find out first-hand how her retreats are doing so she can fix potential problems before expanding the business to 300 new locations.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Roberta Smithies from the Lake District in Cumbria hopes to wave goodbye to her childhood home and embrace a new life in Costa Rica. She has a budget of £200,000 and hopes Jonnie Irwin will find her a property with views that are impressive enough to tempt her to make an offer.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Is Love Racist? The Dating Game
programme.desc: Sociologist and broadcaster Emma Dabiri looks at racism in Britain through the world of modern dating, unveiling the results of a national survey of British online dating habits. A volunteer group of young British singletons take part in a series of experiments to discover if there's more than meets the eye going on in the flighty world of modern dating apps. Emma also meets a number of controversial interviewees - from Mobo-award-winning rapper Nadia Rose, through to BAME equal opportunities campaigner Baroness McGregor-Smith.(n)

programme.desc: While spending the night at Grandpa and Granny Pig's house, George and Peppa stay up late to help catch slugs and snails.(n)

programme.title: Wissper
programme.desc: A kangaroo turns to Wissper for help when her joey will not leave the pouch.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Rubble pretends to be a superhero, which leads to him getting trapped in a tunnel and the other pups needing to rescue him.(n)

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the team work at Fixham campsite, where Leo alarms the machines with his spooky stories and Dizzy takes care of an injured creature.(n)

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Nipper accidentally dislodges a train's brake and sends the crowded and driverless locomotive careering across the mountains.(n)

programme.title: Olly the Little White Van
programme.desc: Olly steps in to help when Lisa Limo discovers she is double-booked, and must take Sir Ronald Grump from the train station to the other side of town for an important meeting.(n)

programme.title: Olly the Little White Van
programme.desc: Olly takes Suzy to his ice-skating lessons when Bazza refuses to play volleyball with her.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Ryder's robot pup malfunctions, and when it ends up going on a rampage around Adventure Bay, it is up to the Paw Patrol to stop it.(n)

programme.title: Blaze and the Monster Machines
programme.desc: Darington plans to fly to the moon - but his battery-powered rocket runs out of energy, so Blaze has to find a way to power it up.(n)

programme.title: Noddy: Toyland Detective
programme.sub-title: Noddy and the Case of the Sleepy Toys.
programme.desc: No one in Brickabuild can get any sleep because someone keeps turning on the lights all night, and as a consequence everyone keeps falling asleep during the day. Unless Noddy can find the culprit, all building in Toyland may stop for good.(n)

programme.title: Wissper
programme.desc: The little girl asks Stripes the tiger to restore order among the playful monkeys.(n)

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Queen Thistle enlists the help of Mrs Elf and becomes Daisy and Poppy's new teacher.(n)

programme.title: Shimmer and Shine
programme.desc: Leah invites Shimmer and Shine to their first-ever sleepover party, where they will eat pizza, dance and sleep in a pillow fort - but the plans go awry.(n)

programme.title: Little Princess
programme.desc: The youngster is pleased to get a new sledge.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George pack their favourite toys to take on holiday and Granny and Grandpa are left to look after Goldie the Fish.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her family go to Italy, where Daddy Pig has trouble driving on the other side of the road.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The piglet and her family spend the first day in their Italian holiday villa before visiting a nearby village, where they find plenty of things to buy.(n)

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: The fairies wake up to find their wands are not working, forcing the kingdom to go without the help of magic for a day.(n)

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
programme.desc: A mutant fox with a grudge against Tiger Claw steals a set of magic weapons from the museum, and uses them to inflict a curse of Casey.(n)

programme.title: Make You Laugh Out Loud
programme.sub-title: Animals Make You Laugh Out Loud.
programme.desc: Another compilation of comical clips, this time featuring animals in zoos, safari parks and their natural habitat, with cheeky monkeys, a goat with a grudge and a loved-up llama. A mother and daughter's trip to the safari park turns into a nightmare when they are attacked by a one-eyed emu, and a woman's holiday takes an unexpected turn when she becomes the object of affection for a frisky dolphin. Animal behaviour therapist Professor Peter Neville joins Des Clarke and Zoe Lyons to provide a little scientific background to the these animal urges.(n)

programme.title: Make You Laugh Out Loud
programme.sub-title: Kittens Make You Laugh Out Loud.
programme.desc: Compilation of internet videos featuring kittens doing bizarre and humorous things.(n)

programme.title: Make You Laugh Out Loud
programme.sub-title: Naughty Dogs Make You Laugh Out Loud.
programme.desc: Iain Lee presents a compilation of internet videos featuring dogs, including two labradors plotting an elaborate cookie heist and the UK's smallest canine, which is only 13 inches long. With contributions from Des Clarke, Zoe Lyons and Marek Larwood.(n)

programme.title: Make You Laugh Out Loud
programme.sub-title: Cats Make You Laugh Out Loud 4.
programme.desc: Iain Lee narrates a compilation of videos featuring cats doing bizarre and humorous things, including internet celebrity Pompous Albert and a feline rock climber. With contributions from Andi Osho, Felicity Ward and Scott Capurro.(n)

programme.title: Racing Stripes
programme.desc: A farmer reluctantly agrees to adopt a zebra left behind by a travelling circus - but is astonished to discover the animal has an amazing talent for racing and decides to enter it in a big competition. Family comedy adventure, starring Hayden Panettiere and Bruce Greenwood, with the voices of Frankie Muniz, Dustin Hoffman, Mandy Moore and Snoop Dogg.(n)

programme.title: Alvin and the Chipmunks
programme.desc: A mischievous trio of talking chipmunks invade a struggling songwriter's home. When the furry critters demonstrate a remarkable talent for singing, he agrees to help them find fame and fortune. However, an unscrupulous record company boss has other plans. Children's comedy, starring Jason Lee and David Cross, with the voices of Justin Long, Matthew Gray Gubler and Jesse McCartney.(n)

programme.title: FIA Formula E Live
programme.desc: The second New York ePrix race. Coverage of the second of two races staged at the Brooklyn Street Circuit in New York, which serves as the 10th round of the season.(n)

programme.title: Cricket on 5
programme.sub-title: England v South Africa: Second Test Day Three.
programme.desc: England v South Africa. Highlights of the third day's play in the Second Test of the four-match series, which took place at Trent Bridge in Nottingham. With commentary by Graeme Smith, Geoffrey Boycott, Simon Hughes, Michael Vaughan and Mark Nicholas.(n)

programme.title: That's So
programme.desc: An entertaining reflection on the year, which saw the wedding of Lady Diana Spencer and Prince Charles draw a global record audience of 750 million people, US president Ronald Reagan and Pope John Paul II survive assassination attempts, the first Rubik's Cube world championship, the Magic Stick become the latest must-have toy and in music the emergence of the New Romantic era.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: Daily round-up of highlights, revealing how the housemates are getting on under the all-seeing eye of Big Brother, featuring the latest tasks, games, arguments, laughs, diary room visits and bedroom chit-chat. Narrated by Marcus Bentley.(n)

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.desc: Cops Schmidt and Jenko hated each other when they were at school together, but have grown up to become friends. They are forced to relive the horrors of their adolescence when their captain decides their youthful appearance makes them the perfect undercover agents to crack a high-school drug ring. Comedy inspired by the 1980s TV series, with Jonah Hill and Channing Tatum. Includes 5 News Update at 11pm.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines, sports news and weather.(n)

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.desc: Cops Schmidt and Jenko hated each other when they were at school together, but have grown up to become friends. They are forced to relive the horrors of their adolescence when their captain decides their youthful appearance makes them the perfect undercover agents to crack a high-school drug ring. Comedy inspired by the 1980s TV series, with Jonah Hill and Channing Tatum. Includes 5 News Update at 11pm.(n)

programme.title: OMG
programme.desc: Men who are determined to achieve their ideal of male beauty. A Merseyside resident is considering penis enlargement surgery, a pop star hopes to further his career by developing the perfect body, a stripper hopes to gain more attention on social media, and a Manchester man has had collagen injections in his lips.(n)

programme.title: SuperCasino
programme.desc: Viewers get the chance to take part in live interactive gaming, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions.(n)

programme.title: Shock Docs
programme.desc: Light-hearted documentary shedding light on the lives of people whose extravagant tastes often leave their parents or significant others substantially out of pocket. These so-called `divas' are more than willing to throw tantrums, manipulate relatives and resort to emotional blackmail to get what they want. Among the pampered persons highlighted are shopping-obsessive Janey, who withholds sex from her fiance as a means of getting access to his bank account, and ambitious teen Romy, who demands her mother supply her with a `big budget' wardrobe to match her big dreams. Also featured is apprentice hairdresser Matthew, who plans to emulate the camp excess of Lady Gaga as a performer, much to the dismay of long-suffering boyfriend Dylan.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Greatest Bridges
programme.desc: For 17 years from 1981 to 1998, the Humber Bridge was the longest single-span suspension bridge in the world, and many consider it to be Britain's most beautiful. Rob Bell discovers the facts about its groundbreaking construction, why it took so long to build and how it changed the lives of the people of Hull and North Lincolnshire. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Great Artists
programme.desc: The life and work of Pieter Bruegel the Elder, generally considered the greatest Flemish painter of the 16th century, whose works remain among the most distinctive examples of Renaissance art, combining gritty humour with political comment. Tim Marlow reveals how Bruegel was influenced by the period of immense social change in which he lived.(n)

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: Four orphaned hedgehogs are rescued, and an adventurous squirrel needs assistance.(n)

programme.title: Angels of Jarm
programme.desc: Angel Ellie arrives on Jarm and shows the children how she prays.(n)

programme.title: Roary the Racing Car
programme.desc: Roary and Tin Top offer to run the workshop while Big Chris has a nap.(n)

programme.title: The Mr Men Show
programme.desc: Mr Quiet battles with noisy birds, and Miss Scary warns a group of seashell-seekers to be wary of lurking monsters.(n)

programme.title: Mofy
programme.desc: A fallen apple inspires Mofy to write a song, but she is having trouble finishing it. When Kerry invites her to his house for tea, she hopes he can help.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: George and Peppa paint a picture of a cherry tree.(n)

programme.title: Little Princess
programme.desc: The youngster decides to open a shop and searches the castle for things to sell. Narrated by Julian Clary.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: The puppies have to find an escaped monkey, which ran away while being taken by train to the zoo.(n)

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: While Bob and his team set to work on a new zipline, Leo makes mistakes and starts to question whether or not he is cut out to be a builder.(n)

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Sarah pretends she has seen the Pontypandyness Monster in the hope of boosting visitors to the mountains, but her plan goes a little too well. As the activity centre becomes filled with people, the oversized crowd leads to a big problem on the unfinished jetty.(n)

programme.title: Thomas & Friends
programme.desc: Bertie suddenly remembers he has to collect a group of people and cannot be late.(n)

programme.title: Shimmer and Shine
programme.desc: The twin genies-in-training discover a magical gem that makes two of everything - including Zeta.(n)

programme.title: Noddy: Toyland Detective
programme.sub-title: Noddy and the Case of the Secret Deliveries.
programme.desc: Noddy tries to find out who is leaving presents for everyone in Toyland so that the residents of the town can thank them.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.sub-title: Pups and the Trouble with Turtles.
programme.desc: Lots of baby turtles cause chaos when they appear all over town. Ryder and the pups must gather them up and take them back to their pond.(n)

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Nanny Plum and the Wise Old Elf compete to build a boat that will beat the Marigolds.(n)

programme.title: Digby Dragon
programme.desc: Fizzy offers to deliver a picture to Digby, but it ends up covered in mud.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The postman's daughter Zoe Zebra delivers a very special letter for Peppa and George - an invitation to her birthday party.(n)

programme.title: Wissper
programme.desc: Herbert the shire horse seems to have lost his strength, so Wissper calls in Dan the panda for a second opinion on what is wrong.(n)

programme.title: Wanda and the Alien
programme.desc: Wanda tries to tickle Alien, but soon realises it is not what he is tickled with, but where he is tickled that will make him laugh.(n)

programme.title: The Wright Stuff
programme.desc: Journalist and broadcaster Matthew Wright is joined by a panel of guests and the studio audience to debate the issues of the day.(n)

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: A property owner is ready to set up a new family home with his fiancee, but is reluctant to sell his existing premises due to the influence of his teenage children.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Lunchtime
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: Daily round-up of highlights, revealing how the housemates are getting on under the all-seeing eye of Big Brother, featuring the latest tasks, games, arguments, laughs, diary room visits and bedroom chit-chat. Narrated by Marcus Bentley.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Nate takes Leah kayaking to cheer her up and it is clear that there is a spark between them, while John gives in to Marilyn's pleading and arranges another counselling session.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Gary thinks Terese must be pregnant, but she tells him she is just off colour. Tensions mount between Steph and Leo, while some of Piper's messages about Xanthe are leaked to Tyler.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A childhood friend of Gibbs' dead daughter is stalked by a marine who recently returned from Iraq, and asks the agent for help. Memories of his murdered family lead him to make the case a priority, but he acts on his initiative and leaves HQ without his badge, making DiNozzo fear he is risking his job for a personal vendetta. Mark Harmon and Michael Weatherly star.(n)

programme.title: Fatal Performance
programme.desc: An aspiring actress, working as a waitress, is offered a lucrative contract to impersonate the wife of a businessman during a prestigious reception event in their home. However, she soon learns the devious truth behind the proposal and what seemed like a simple job soon turns into a nightmare scenario. Thriller, starring Nicholle Tom and David Palffy. Edited for daytime broadcast.(n)

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Gary thinks Terese must be pregnant, but she tells him she is just off colour. Tensions mount between Steph and Leo, while some of Piper's messages about Xanthe are leaked to Tyler.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Nate takes Leah kayaking to cheer her up and it is clear that there is a spark between them, while John gives in to Marilyn's pleading and arranges another counselling session.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Tonight
programme.desc: A round-up of the evening's headlines, including coverage of the latest national and international stories.(n)

programme.title: Cricket on 5
programme.sub-title: England v South Africa: Second Test Day Four.
programme.desc: England v South Africa. Highlights of the fourth day's play in the Second Test of the four-match series, which took place at Trent Bridge in Nottingham. With commentary by Graeme Smith, Geoffrey Boycott, Simon Hughes, Michael Vaughan and Mark Nicholas.(n)

programme.title: All New Traffic Cops
programme.desc: An insight into the working life of officers patrolling the nation's roads, using modern technology and old-fashioned methods to bring criminals to justice.(n)

programme.title: Eamonn & Ruth: How the Other Half Lives
programme.desc: Eamonn Holmes and Ruth Langsford head to Moscow to infiltrate the exclusive world of billionaire oligarchs. They meet the son of one of Russia's wealthiest men, as well as the owner of an exclusive department store in the city, and learn about the whims of the Russian elite.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: Daily round-up of highlights, revealing how the housemates are getting on under the all-seeing eye of Big Brother, featuring the latest tasks, games, arguments, laughs, diary room visits and bedroom chit-chat. Narrated by Marcus Bentley.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother's Bit on the Side
programme.desc: Rylan Clark-Neal presents the live Big Brother companion show, including a debate on the burning issues and celebrity guests' thoughts on the latest developments.(n)

programme.title: Alien Resurrection
programme.desc: In the fourth instalment of the sci-fi saga, Ripley returns from the dead when she is cloned by a crazed geneticist in order to retrieve the alien baby inside her. Joining forces with a group of bandits who have hidden themselves on board the ship, she is soon back battling against the alien menace, knowing all the while that cloning has fused human and alien DNA in her blood and time is not on her side(n)

programme.title: Eraser
programme.desc: When business executive Lee Cullen uncovers a plot to deliver a super-weapon into enemy hands, she is assigned to the witness protection programme under US Marshal John 'Eraser' Kruger. But just who is hunting Lee down? Action(n)

programme.title: Diner
programme.desc: Set in 1959, Diner shows how five young men resist their adulthood and seek refuge in their beloved Diner(n)

programme.title: Body of Lies
programme.desc: Trust no one. Deceive everyone. When idealistic CIA agent Roger Ferris (Di Caprio -- The Departed, Blood Diamond) is stationed in Jordan after being wounded in Iraq, he dedicates his life to stopping further attacks by Al Qaeda. Following a plan that the British employed successfully against the Nazis, Ferris plants the suspicion among the terrorists that their leaders are collaborating with the Americans. But as the stakes rise and Ferris finds himself in the crosshairs, the plot he starts spirals into an outcome he could never have foreseen(n)

programme.title: Man on the Moon
programme.desc: Biopic of controversial comedian Andy Kaufman, starring Jim Carrey. Star of Taxi and Saturday Night Live, Kaufman was a troubled individual for whom the boundaries of reality and stage performance were often blurred. Frequently misunderstood, even by those closest to him, he remained a strictly maverick entertainer until his untimely death from lung cancer in 1984(n)

programme.title: The 9th Life of Louis Drax
programme.desc: A young lad survives a catastrophic event on his ninth birthday. A doctor examines the extraordinary accident and the instances that affected his life(n)

programme.title: Race
programme.desc: Legendary black Olympian Jesse Owens competes in track and field at the 1936 Games in Nazi Germany, despite the host country's attempts to turn the event into a celebration of national pride and Aryan supremacy(n)

programme.title: Die Hard With a Vengeance
programme.desc: Things aren't going well for John McClane: his marriage is breaking up, he's been suspended from the force and now the brother of Hans Gruber, the German terrorist he threw off a building a few years back, is threatening to blow up a school if McClane doesn't run around the city solving his demeaning and dangerous puzzles. With the help of Zeus, a Harlem electrician, McClane discovers Gruber's plot to distract the NYPD while he clears the federal bank of billions of dollars of gold(n)

programme.title: Changing Lanes
programme.desc: (2002) Ben Affleck plays well-heeled lawyer Gavin Banek dashing to a meeting; while Samuel L Jackson takes the role of Doyle Gipson, an estranged husband on his way to a child custody hearing. When the pair's cars collide in a minor accident, Banek dashes off a cheque and leaves, little knowing he's accidentally taken a document crucial to Gipson's hearing that sees him lose the case. But Gipson has an equally vital document belonging to Banek and so begins a battle of wills and wits in Roger Michell's fast-moving thriller(n)

programme.title: Dallas Buyers Club
programme.desc: Compelling drama starring an Oscar-winning Matthew McConaughey as a macho rodeo cowboy who is diagnosed with HIV(n)

programme.title: The 9th Life of Louis Drax
programme.desc: A young lad survives a catastrophic event on his ninth birthday. A doctor examines the extraordinary accident and the instances that affected his life(n)

programme.title: The Vanishing
programme.desc: George Sluizer's 1992 English-language remake of his 1988 Dutch thriller The Vanishing follows the same plot-line as the original film, yet with one important difference. The film details a young man's (Kiefer Sutherland) search for his girlfriend (Sandra Bullock), who disappeared at a gas station after the couple had a fight. Where the original film didn't reveal what happened to the girlfriend until late into the movie, the 1992 version opens with her kidnapper (Jeff Bridges) plotting his abduction. Over the course of the film, Sutherland's search for Bullock is intercut with footage of Bridges that illustrates his mental illness and his repeated attempts to abduct women(n)

programme.title: Body of Lies
programme.desc: Trust no one. Deceive everyone. When idealistic CIA agent Roger Ferris (Di Caprio -- The Departed, Blood Diamond) is stationed in Jordan after being wounded in Iraq, he dedicates his life to stopping further attacks by Al Qaeda. Following a plan that the British employed successfully against the Nazis, Ferris plants the suspicion among the terrorists that their leaders are collaborating with the Americans. But as the stakes rise and Ferris finds himself in the crosshairs, the plot he starts spirals into an outcome he could never have foreseen(n)

programme.title: Live Free or Die Hard
programme.desc: John McClane takes on terrorists targeting government computer systems(n)

programme.title: Scent of a Woman
programme.desc: Driven by an extravagant, tour-de-force performance by Al Pacino, Scent of a Woman is the story of Frank Slade (Pacino), a blind, retired army colonel who hires Charlie Simms (Chris O'Donnell), a poor college student on the verge of expulsion, to take care of him over Thanksgiving weekend. At the beginning of the weekend, Frank takes Charlie to New York, where he reveals to the student that he intends to visit his family, have a few terrific meals, sleep with a beautiful woman and, finally, commit suicide. The film follows the mis-matched pair over the course of the weekend, as they learn about life through their series of adventures. Though the story is a little contrived and predictable, it pulls all the right strings, thanks to O'Donnell's sympathetic supporting role and Pacino's powerful lead performance, for which he won his first Academy Award. Scent of a Woman is based on the 1975 Italian film Profumo Di Donna(n)

programme.title: Dog Day Afternoon
programme.desc: Sonny plans a bank robbery to pay for a sex-change operation for his gay lover. But when the heist goes wrong, he and silent Sal take the bank staff hostage. Thriller(n)

programme.title: Aliens
programme.desc: Sci-fi sequel in which Ripley wakes up after 57 years in suspended animation to discover that the alien nightmare is beginning all over again(n)

programme.title: In the Heart of the Sea
programme.desc: In the winter of 1820, the crew of the New England whaling ship Essex struggle for their survival after an attack by a rogue sperm whale leaves them stranded at sea for 90 days(n)

programme.title: Gods of Egypt
programme.desc: A young thief named Bek (Brenton Thwaites) enlists the help of the powerful Egyptian god Horus (Nikolaj Coster-Waldau) to overthrow the vicious deity Set (Gerard Butler), who has seized control of the land. Bek's true love has been captured, forcing the mortal rebel to fight back in order to free her and the people of Egypt from Set's tyrannical rule. This epic fantasy adventure was directed by Alex Proyas (The Crow), and co-stars Geoffrey Rush, Chadwick Boseman, and Courtney Eaton(n)

programme.title: Any Given Sunday
programme.desc: Al Pacino delivers an explosive performance as a burnt-out American football coach who finds himself under pressure when the team's owner tries to rejuvenate the losing team(n)

programme.title: Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: Kevin Costner stars in this epic western biopic chronicling the life of legendary lawman Wyatt Earp, from Dodge City to the shootout at the OK Corral(n)

programme.title: Pale Rider
programme.desc: Clint Eastwood stars as the mysterious preacher determined to stop ruthless landowners from stealing the land of a group of poor gold miners(n)

programme.title: Alien 3
programme.desc: The third outing for Sigourney Weaver (alias Officer Ripley) and the acid-dripping creature which has pursued her ever since it popped out of John Hurt's chest back in 1979. On a tough, all-male prison colony planet, the shaven- headed Ripley realizes that she and her fellow humans are not alone, but convincing the hardened prisoners and wardens does not prove easy(n)

programme.title: Scent of a Woman
programme.desc: Driven by an extravagant, tour-de-force performance by Al Pacino, Scent of a Woman is the story of Frank Slade (Pacino), a blind, retired army colonel who hires Charlie Simms (Chris O'Donnell), a poor college student on the verge of expulsion, to take care of him over Thanksgiving weekend. At the beginning of the weekend, Frank takes Charlie to New York, where he reveals to the student that he intends to visit his family, have a few terrific meals, sleep with a beautiful woman and, finally, commit suicide. The film follows the mis-matched pair over the course of the weekend, as they learn about life through their series of adventures. Though the story is a little contrived and predictable, it pulls all the right strings, thanks to O'Donnell's sympathetic supporting role and Pacino's powerful lead performance, for which he won his first Academy Award. Scent of a Woman is based on the 1975 Italian film Profumo Di Donna(n)

Bek's true love has been captured, forcing the mortal rebel to fight back in order to free her and the people of Egypt from Set's tyrannical rule. This epic fantasy adventure was directed by Alex Proyas (The Crow), and co-stars Geoffrey Rush, Chadwick Boseman, and Courtney Eaton(n)

programme.title: The Longest Yard
programme.desc: One of the toughest and best-remembered sports movies of the 1970s gets a humorous makeover in this comedy. Paul "Wrecking" Crewe (Adam Sandler) was once a famous professional football player, but after several years out of the limelight and an alcohol problem have taken their toll, Crewe is arrested for a serious traffic accident aggravated by the fact he was drunk. Crewe is sentenced to Allenville Penitentiary, where Warden Hazen (James Cromwell) is something of a football fan. Hazen had organized his guards into an impressive football team, and clears a healthy profit by taking bets on their games. Looking to make the competition more interesting, Hazen suggests that Crewe put together a team from the inmate population to play his guards. With the help of fellow prisoner Caretaker (Chris Rock), Crewe recruits the heaviest hitters from the cell block for the team, but the guys don't play like a unit until Crewe and Caretaker get some help from Nate Scarborough (Burt Reynolds), a former college and NFL coach doing hard time. Adapted from Robert Aldrich's 1974 box-office smash of the same name, The Longest Yard also features rap star Nelly and Nicholas Turturro; the film has previously been loosely remade in 2001 as Mean Machine, with the action moved to England and the game changed to soccer(n)

programme.desc: A witness gives Ben and Nate a lead after their patrol car is hit by a stray bullet, but no evidence can be found to identify the owner of a vehicle seen speeding from the scene. The investigation takes a sudden turn when forensics discover two bullet casings outside the home of their eyewitness. Meanwhile, morale is at a low ebb at Sun Hill over the lack of support offered to Callum over the recent accusations of assault.(n)

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Conway has to man the barricades during a riot situation - while Glaze has his own problems to deal with.(n)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nuns find a newborn baby on the steps of the convent. The discovery prompts the community to rally round, providing food and clothing for the unexpected arrival. But the question remains - who is his mother and why did she leave him there? While the investigation gets under way, Jenny gets caught up in the mystery surrounding semi-vagrant local Mrs Jenkins, and the newly married Chummy pulls out all the stops to mount a successful children's nativity play. Jessica Raine, Miranda Hart, Pam Ferris and Jenny Agutter star.(n)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nuns and midwives move into their new premises following the explosion that wrecked the old Nonnatus House, and are joined by fresh arrival Sister Winifred - a kindly-but-naive young woman. Jenny becomes concerned about new mother Merle's mental state and the welfare of her baby, who isn't feeding properly. Dr Turner believes it could be something more serious - although the mystery is eventually solved by the last person anyone would have expected. Chummy is struggling to adjust to her new role as a housewife and mother, and organises an open day at the community centre. Jessica Raine, Stephen McGann and Miranda Hart star.(n)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Trixie's feathers are ruffled when Jenny is promoted, but the new Acting Sister has more to worry about after a mother-to-be reveals the baby she is carrying was not fathered by her husband - and to complicate matters, the real father is black. Cynthia is inspired by a lecture on natural childbirth, convinced it will help an overly anxious patient, while Alec and his friends try to persuade Jenny to join them on a CND march. Jessica Raine, Helen George and Bryony Hannah star in the 1950s-set nursing drama.(n)

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Rag Nymph
programme.desc: Feature-length period melodrama set in Victorian times, charting the relationship between feisty Newcastle rag-woman Aggie Winkowski and 10-year-old orphan Millie Forester. Determined to protect Millie from the seamy world of prostitution, Aggie resolves to take the youngster under her wing. Starring Honeysuckle Weeks, Perdita Weeks, Val McLane, Alec Newman, Crispin Bonham-Carter and Patrick Ryecart.(n)

programme.title: The Musketeers
programme.desc: Aramis and d'Artagnan are thwarted in their attempt to transport a young woman from a village to the palace when armed men abduct her baby. The swordsmen must find out who she is and why anyone would go to such lengths to kidnap the boy. Meanwhile, the king's royal hunting party is disrupted by the sudden appearance of his banished mother Marie de Medici, seeking royal protection from an unknown assassin. Guest starring Amy Nuttall and Tara FitzGerald.(n)

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: The duo plunge headlong into a murder case, investigating a glamorous beautician accused of killing her former lover - a plastic surgeon who had threatened to ruin the launch of her new book. Offbeat detective drama, starring Caroline Quentin and Alan Davies.(n)

programme.title: The Doctor Blake Mysteries
programme.desc: The death of a local farmer leads Blake into Ballarat's murky world of late-night, back-street gambling and two brothers with contrasting fortunes.(n)

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Double bill. Nikki and Jack investigate when a man is run down and killed by a Tube train - although not long after, a female vicar is murdered on the Underground, leaving them with the difficult prospect of building a case against her distraught husband. However, when a young roofer is stalked and brutally killed on his journey home, CCTV cameras pick up a suspect who links the deaths, and a full-scale manhunt is launched. Meanwhile, Nikki forms a bond with one of the detectives, who asks her to help re-evaluate his father's murder when he was a child. Emilia Fox, David Caves and Richard Lintern star.(n)

programme.title: Spooks
programme.desc: The re-emergence of strike action brings a winter of discontent as firefighters, nurses, teachers, air traffic controllers, council workers and rail employees all clash with the Government. MI5 closely monitors the situation, aware of the inherent dangers - but when it discovers a section of the British Army is planning a walk-out of its own, it faces a battle to ensure the stability and security of the country. Reece Dinsdale guest stars, with Matthew Macfadyen and Keeley Hawes.(n)

programme.title: The Lost World
programme.desc: Bob Hoskins stars in the first of a lavish two-part adventure based on Arthur Conan Doyle's novel about a British scientific team's 1911 expedition into the uncharted Amazon jungle in search of prehistoric life. Maverick Professor Challenger leads the quest for a mythical plateau, aiming to prove his theory that dinosaurs still roam certain parts of the Earth.(n)

programme.title: The Lost World
programme.desc: Trapped on the plateau, Edward, Agnes and Lord Roxton set out in search of professors Challenger and Summerlee, following their capture by the strange apemen who may provide the missing link between modern man and prehistoric life. But when they mount a rescue, the explorers are confronted by a tribe of Indians. Conclusion of the adventure, starring Bob Hoskins, Peter Falk and James Fox.(n)

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits one of the National Gardens Scheme participants, Clearbeck House in Lancashire, where beautiful sculptures blend with the flowers and wildlife.(n)

programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

Eleven-year-old Pip's life is changed dramatically by an encounter with escaped convict Abel Magwitch. With David Suchet, Gillian Anderson, Mark Addy and Claire Rushbrook.(n)

The dead youngster's cousin reveals the lad was - uncharacteristically - involved in a drug deal to help his mother make ends meet, but the prime suspects are released because of a lack of evidence. programme.title: The Bill

Callum, visiting Sun Hill to discuss his suspension, follows the unfolding case and cannot resist chipping in with his opinion of the suspect, but it is solid work by his colleagues in the uniform branch that finally tracks the missing child to a storm drain beside the Thames, where rapidly rising water puts several lives in danger. programme.desc: A British cop is murdered on the Caribbean island of Saint Marie, and the local commissioner declares another officer from the UK must be flown over to lead the investigation. Enter DI Richard Poole, a brilliant detective with a unique approach to cracking crime, and just the man to solve the mystery of his colleague's death. The only problem is, he is totally unsuited to a life of sun, sea and sand - and worse still, it seems his boss back home wants him to stay there. programme.title: Sex and the City
programme.desc: Sex and the City. In the pilot episode of Sex and the City, Carrie (Sarah Jessica Parker) and her pals attend a thirtysomething birthday party for Miranda (Cynthia Nixon), where they make a heartfelt pledge to stop worrying about finding Mr. Perfect and, instead, have sex like him. Making good on this vow, Carrie dabbles with an ex and then meets the rakish businessman Mr. Big (Chris Noth). Miranda, meanwhile, finds herself attracted to the teddy bear-ish Skipper, and the ever-voracious Samantha (Kim Cattrall) beds a bloke who Charlotte (Kristin Davis) wouldn't get horizontal with on the first date(n)

programme.title: Sex and the City
