programme.desc: Bay of Married Pigs. Carrie is set up with a man who is looking for marriage, but when they don't click she dumps him on Charlotte(n)

programme.desc: Valley of the Twenty-Something Guys. While Carrie tries to juggle a too-busy Big with a flirty fling, Samantha worries that she's getting old. Timothy Olyphant guest stars(n)

programme.desc: Raj lusts after a girl he and Sheldon meet at a university party, and Leonard comes to regret airing his disapproval of Penny's belief in psychics. Comedy, starring Kunal Nayyar and Jim Parsons.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Sheldon's flat is burgled, so they work on a state-of-the-art security system in a bid to outwit any future would-be thieves. However, their plans go awry when they ensnare Penny in a net. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard's purchase of a dining-room table causes Sheldon to re-evaluate his life. Meanwhile, Howard is offered the chance to go back to the International Space Station, and Bernadette struggles to decide whether to encourage him. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Melissa Rauch.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: After arguing with Sheldon, Howard tries to make amends by taking him to Nasa's headquarters in Houston. Elsewhere, Penny has second thoughts about quitting her job as a waitress when her car dies, while Amy tries to find Raj a date. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard, Sheldon and Howard face problems when they file for a patent for their infinite persistence gyroscope. Plus, Penny, Amy and Bernadette give Raj dating advice when Emily reaches out to him after their breakup. Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco star.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy is shocked at a revelation from Sheldon after she buys him a new laptop, while Raj sells out Leonard and Howard after they lie to their wives in order to attend an early screening of a movie. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: On a weekend cabin trip with Penny and Amy, Sheldon spills one of Leonard's secrets, while Howard and Bernadette must draw a line when Raj goes overboard with pregnancy gifts. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Sheldon disagree over whether to continue holding their regular Roommate Agreement meetings, with Leonard suggesting they are no longer required, while Sheldon believes they are still essential. As the pair's squabble quickly escalates into a full-blown argument, the rest of their friends turn up for a planned Game of Thrones viewing party, and end up taking sides in the dispute - resulting in two warring factions taking up residence in 4A and 4B. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon, Amy, Leonard and Penny try to divide their collective belongings into two separate households. Meanwhile, Raj and Stuart work to prove themselves indispensable.(n)

programme.title: The Crystal Maze
programme.desc: Maze Master Richard Ayoade guides Andrea McLean, Spencer Matthews, Tom Allen, Stacey Solomon and Joe Swash through the Aztec, Medieval, Industrial and Futuristic zones. In each one, the contestants must conquer physical, skill, mystery and mental challenges in a bid to win crystals, which add to their time inside the Crystal Dome, where they hope to collect gold tokens to convert into cash for the Stand Up to Cancer charity.(n)

programme.title: Speed
programme.desc: An LAPD cop discovers a psychopathic criminal has planted a bomb on a crowded bus, primed to go off if the vehicle drops below 50mph. He boards the vehicle and helps the hapless passenger who has been forced to take the wheel to keep a constant speed to avoid a disaster. Action thriller, starring Keanu Reeves, Sandra Bullock, Dennis Hopper and Jeff Daniels.(n)

programme.title: Rude Tube
programme.desc: Featuring a parrot that thinks it is the pop star Sia, a man who saves the life of a kookaburra with a tyre pump and a chimpanzee that has a go at virtual reality.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The nation's favourite armchair critics offer their passionate and sometimes emotional critiques of Britain's Got Talent, Natural World: Kangaroo Dundee, The Secret, Jaws, Bake Off: Creme de la Creme, Paul Merton's Secret Stations and the News. First shown in May 2016.(n)

programme.title: Tattoo Fixers
programme.desc: Sketch covers up Ste's shoddy Egyptian-themed tattoo that was originally done in a downstairs toilet by a Hell's Angel, while Jay is given free rein to design a cover for Jake, who has upset his girlfriend and his mother with his ill-advised ink. Amy calls on Alice to help regain her body confidence after having a mastectomy, while Harley needs the fixers' help before he wears a kilt at his wedding, and Kara needs to lose the inappropriate emoji that could cost her a place in the police force.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: Irreverent panel show hosted by Jimmy Carr, in which guests join team captains Rob Beckett and Aisling Bea to answer questions based on opinion polls. Aisling is joined by Ant Middleton and Katherine Ryan, while Rob teams up with comedy actress Kerry Howard and new comic Ola.(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Barry's membership of a friendship group is jeopardised and a family swear jar is introduced. Comedy, starring Wendi McLendon-Covey and Jeff Garlin.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Omnibus. Granny Campbell wants Courtney to come back to Scotland and Grace freaks Warren out, while Darren plans a special foreign film night for Nancy, but when Kyle calls asking for them to visit, he begins to panic.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Cindy hires Leela as her cleaner, but Leela has a motive, while Darren is tempted by money from Shane, while Farrah visits Scott. Myra uses Mac to motivate Marnie.(n)

programme.title: Made in Chelsea
programme.desc: Cracks start appearing in Binky and JP's relationship, while Sam is left heartbroken when he finds out Tiff has arranged to go on a date with Ollie.(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement
programme.desc: Jeff and Audrey enrol in a cookery class, already attended by Adam and Jen, as a way of spending more time together. However, things soon get competitive between the two couples. Meanwhile, Timmy is disturbed when he realises he has a lot of things in common with Russell's new girlfriend. Comedy, with Patrick Warburton and David Spade.(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement
programme.desc: Jeff invites his old college friend Heidi round to show Audrey that she does not have romantic feelings for him, but the plan backfires when she makes a shocking confession. Meanwhile, Adam designs a test to help him choose his best man, and Timmy announces he is leaving Russell's employment.(n)

programme.title: Melissa & Joey
programme.desc: Mel tries to gain votes by co-hosting a local TV show with Joe, and their on-camera bickering makes them an instant hit. But their popularity begins to have an effect on Lennox and Ryder, so they must decide on whether fame or family is more important. Family comedy, starring Melissa Joan Hart and Joey Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: Melissa & Joey
programme.desc: Mel's new boyfriend Noah temporarily moves in to her apartment while his is being renovated, and Lennox starts a dream internship at a local newspaper - but struggles to wake up in time for work.(n)

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Against Bonnie's advice, Ben persuades Danny to sign a sponsorship deal with a company that makes a brand of energy drink - but things go wrong at a photoshoot. Meanwhile, Riley takes an interest in volunteering and accepts a job helping out at the hospital. Comedy, starring Jean-Luc Bilodeau.(n)

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Dr Shaw decides that Riley is the reason Danny cannot focus during ice hockey and bans her from his next match. Meanwhile, Riley worries things are moving too fast with Fitch, and Tucker competes with Jenna for a promotion at work. Comedy, starring Chelsea Kane.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Lily and Marshall decide to participate in more grown-up activities as their wedding approaches, and organise a cheese and wine evening. Meanwhile, Ted, Barney and Robin check out the dubious delights of the club scene. US comedy, starring Josh Radnor.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: The friends prepare for their annual Halloween party - which for Ted means another fruitless search for the girl he met at the event several years earlier, but has never seen since. Marshall and Lily enter a costume competition, and Robin introduces everyone to her new boyfriend, Mike.(n)

programme.title: New Girl
programme.desc: Jess agrees to look after Russell's daughter while he is out of town, and does her best to demonstrate good mothering skills. Winston's boss torments him on the way to an important talk-show appearance, Cece is terrified that she might be pregnant, and Nick has to defend his new relationship.(n)

programme.title: New Girl
programme.desc: Jess witnesses an argument between Russell and his ex-wife Ouli (Dermot Mulroney and Jeanne Tripplehorn) and worries that her own relationship with him does not have the same sexual tension. Cece encourages Schmidt to date Nadia, and Nick devotes time to cultivating his vegetables in the rooftop garden.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: When the guys are unable to get tickets for the Comic-Con, Leonard, Howard and Raj decide to buy fake passes from a stranger - but they then worry about getting caught with them. Sheldon decides to hold his own comic-book convention and searches for a suitable star guest for the event. Meanwhile, the girls take tea at a hotel but discover that maturity is over-rated. Comedy, guest starring James Earl Jones and Carrie Fisher.(n)

programme.desc: Sheldon and Amy take a train ride to the Napa Valley with Howard and Bernadette on Valentine's Day, while Leonard and Penny head to the vets when they volunteer to look after Raj's dog. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: Melissa & Joey
programme.desc: After winning a 10-course dining experience in a raffle, Mel decides to join an exercise boot camp to lose some weight before she gorges on the gourmet meal - and she even manages to persuade Joe to teach the class. Meanwhile, Lennox and Zander try to sell their web series. Family comedy, starring Melissa Joan Hart and Joey Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: Melissa & Joey
programme.desc: Mel receives some bad publicity due to Joe when he shares too much with the press at a function, while Ryder decides to ask Stella out on a date, and Lennox and Zander make a big decision about their future.(n)

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Bonnie and Danny take a cookery class run by a noted chef, but when Danny wins the chance to be a guest sous chef, Bonnie is determined to prove that she's the better cook. Tucker advises Riley to make up a fake boyfriend in order to fix her friendship with Danny.(n)

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Ben and Riley play a game of `shot and score', where they compete to see who can kiss a stranger first. Riley sets her sights on a handsome bar patron, while Ben hits it off with another customer. However, when Riley is horrified when her one-night stand turns out to be her new boss. Bonnie uses Riley's office for her real estate business, and Danny makes a big investment in his future.(n)

programme.desc: Advertising executive Andre `Dre''Johnson is happily anticipating a promotion that would make him his company's first black senior vice-president, while his wife Rainbow, an anaesthetist, is looking forward to their successful future. programme.title: Black-ish

programme.desc: Trojan War. This sports documentary probes the University of Southern California's return to the elite of college football under head coach Pete Carroll and the program's precipitous fall from grace when the NCAA hit the school with sanctions. Originally aired on ESPN as part of the network's acclaimed "30 for 30" series, this feature-length doc uses interviews with Carroll, Matt Leinart, LenDale White, and many more to encapsulate the rise and fall of the Trojans during Carroll's nine-year reign at USC. programme.title: Super Senses: The Secret Power of Animals
programme.desc: The concluding episode explores the world of scent and examines the animals that have pushed their sense of smell far beyond human capabilities. In the Bahamas, physicist Helen Czerski dives into shark-infested waters with only a small pouch of liquid as her defence against them, while biologist Patrick Aryee controls the behaviour of a swarm of bees by using tiny traces of scent, and gets uncomfortably close to a skunk.(n)

programme.title: Wild Ones
programme.desc: A look at which animal could be crowned `king'.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Wild France
programme.desc: Part two of two. The unique ecosystem of the Marais Poitevin, where seawater and freshwater come together. Dragonfly larvae gestate in the region's waters, and swim to the surface and fly away once their development is over.(n)

programme.title: Secret Life Underground
programme.desc: Part two of two. Documentary making use of cutting-edge technology to explore the rich biodiversity of soil, revealing why what lies beneath the surface is not just a simple eco-system, but actually a living organism in which countless creatures exist in a state of inter-dependence.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Fishing with Robson Green
programme.desc: The actor visits South Australia, where he dives for abalone, a type of large sea snail, in the waters just south of Port Lincoln. He next heads west to Perth to catch blue manna crab for a traditional Australia Day barbecue, before handling venomous octopuses on a boat in Fremantle. Robson then returns to Port Lincoln to take part in the World Championship Tuna Toss.(n)

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: With the arrival of autumn the Arctic Ocean begins freezing over, and polar bears gather in large numbers on the coast as they await the return of the ice. Two thousand beluga whales head for a particular estuary to thrash against the gravel and exfoliate, while in Antarctica, Adelie penguins take to the sea for the first time and face the danger of leopard seal attacks.(n)

programme.title: Wild France
programme.desc: Part two of two. The unique ecosystem of the Marais Poitevin, where seawater and freshwater come together. Dragonfly larvae gestate in the region's waters, and swim to the surface and fly away once their development is over.(n)

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: Colin Salmon narrates a documentary exploring how the lives of humans and animals across a vast area of the planet are affected by the transforming power of the monsoon rains. The end of the dry season in northern Australia sees 300,000 flying foxes gathering to drink while running a gauntlet of freshwater crocodiles, while in Sumatra a female orang-utan guides her youngster to where she knows a fig tree fruits at this time of year. At the Delhi stock exchange, the price of rice escalates every day the rains fail to materialise and priests submerge themselves in water and beseech Varuna, god of water, to come.(n)

programme.title: Tarsier Tails
programme.desc: The White Rock tarsiers make movements that suggest they are planning to return to their main tree.(n)

programme.title: Tarsier Tails
programme.desc: The Burnt Rock tarsiers face trouble, in the form of intruders within their territory.(n)

programme.title: Walk the Line
programme.desc: James Mangold's Walk the Line tells the life story of country music legend Johnny Cash (Joaquin Phoenix), focusing primarily on the long courtship he had with June Carter (Reese Witherspoon). The film is structured as an extended flashback opening with Cash readying to take the stage at his historic Folsom Prison Concert. The film touches on his childhood, relating a horrific early incident from his life and establishing the troubled relationship he would have with his father (Robert Patrick). Cash joins the military and leaves home. During his time in the armed services he begins writing songs and romances a hometown girl (Ginnifer Goodwin). After the end of his duty he settles down and attempts to begin a music career, but his wife has trouble adjusting to his dreams. Cash auditions for Sam Phillips (Dallas Roberts), signs to Sun Records, and soon finds himself on tour with a roster of young soon-to-be legends that includes Elvis Presley (Tyler Hilton) and Jerry Lee Lewis (Waylon Malloy Payne). On this tour he meets June Carter, the daughter of the famous Carter family, and they take a liking to each other, although she refuses any serious advances from him. Cash gains world-wide fame thanks in part to the inspiration he gets from June, but eventually his marriage crumbles and he develops a serious drug addiction. The film is based on Cash's autobiographies. Phoenix and Witherspoon performed all of their own singing in the movie, just as Sissy Spacek and Beverly D'Angelo did in Coal Miner's Daughter a quarter-century before(n)

programme.title: Summer Rental
programme.desc: After air traffic controller Jack Chester loses a plane (it's covered on his screen by a fly), he's told to take a break. Jack books his family into a plush resort, but it turns out that their lodgings are in a hut by the beach. And that's as good as the vacation gets... 80s comedy(n)

programme.title: Mrs. Doubtfire
programme.desc: Slapstick comedy about a divorced actor who is willing to go to any lengths to get his children back, even posing as a matronly Scottish housekeeper. His family, taken in by the disguise, decide to employ the eccentric but apparently capable 'widow', and everyone is happy with the arrangement - until the mother's old boyfriend reappears(n)

programme.title: Commando
programme.desc: All-action adventure spiced with humour in which a retired Special Forces colonel returns to action when a ruthless South American dictator kidnaps his 11-year-old daughter. Armed to the teeth, he sets out to bring her back, leaving a trail of destruction(n)

programme.title: Support Your Local Gunfighter
programme.desc: James Garner is a thoroughly charming gigolo on the run who not only gets mistaken for a feared gunfighter, but becomes the target of a gun-totin' tomboy in this satirical western comedy(n)

programme.title: Walk the Line

programme.title: Anaconda
programme.desc: Jon Voight stars as Paul Sarone, a slimy snake catcher in the Amazon on the trail of the biggest prize of all - a 40 foot long anaconda. The villainous Sarone will stop at nothing to catch his prey, even taking a documentary film crew hostage so he can use their boat. It's Saturday matinee 'horror' in the style of The Creature From The Black Lagoon - camp and implausibly cheesy, but great fun(n)

programme.title: The Ringer
programme.desc: Madcap physical comedy ensues when an able-bodied man pretends to be disabled in order to sweep the board at the Special Olympics and clean up at the bookies(n)

programme.title: Days of Thunder
programme.desc: Tom Cruise plays Cole Trickle, a young hot-shot stock car racer determined to make it as top gun if he can find the right cocktail of car and manager, who comes along in the guise of racing legend Harry Hogge. As the pair tour the circuits, the climax builds up to Daytona and a showdown between Trickle and his arch-rival Russ Wheeler, who will stop at nothing to beat him. Tony Scott's all-action film captures the all-out excitement and speed of the sport, while Nicole Kidman as Dr Claire Lewicki provides the love interest(n)

programme.title: Idiocracy
programme.desc: Private Joe Bauers, the definition of "average American", is selected by the Pentagon to be the guinea pig for a top-secret hibernation program. Forgotten, he awakes 500 years in the future. He discovers a society so incredibly dumbed-down that he's easily the most intelligent person alive(n)

programme.title: Bowfinger
programme.desc: Hollywood, today: Bobby Bowfinger, a run-down actor-producer-director, is reading a script, which a friend has written. Completely convinced of its quality, he decides to take a last shot at fame and fortune. But the script is not that easy to sell, and a famous producer promises him to do it, but there is one condition: Kit Ramsey, Hollywood's number one star, has to be in it. So, Bobby tries his luck with Kit - who says no - and then decides to shoot the film himself. Together with the cheapest team available in Southern California, with an aspiring beauty from Ohio, with a diva, who is just a little over the hill, with a key-holding gofer from a major studio, and with a goon hired away from burger-flipping, Bobby sets out to shoot the science-fiction-film starring Kit Ramsey - who does not know a bit(n)

programme.title: The Cable Guy
programme.desc: One man wants free cable while his strangely possessive cable guy wants a new friend(n)

programme.title: Dragonheart
programme.desc: The young, sickly King Einon was wounded in a battle. In order for him to survive, he is healed by Draco, a dragon. Some years later, Bowen, a dragon slayer, encounters Draco. The two team up to form a travelling duo that perform an act, but the act is only known by themselves. Bowen supposedly 'slays' Draco and then collects a reward from the town or village that he protects by killing the dragon who had been 'terrorizing' them. From there, Bowen and Draco must save the entire kingdom from the rule of the now evil King Einon, who is part of Draco and Draco a part of him(n)

programme.title: Days of Thunder

programme.title: Paul Blart: Mall Cop
programme.desc: A mild-mannered single dad working as a security guard at a New Jersey mall has to save the day when a gang of thieves try to pull a big heist. Kevin James cowrote and stars in this hilarious farce(n)

programme.title: You Don't Mess With the Zohan
programme.desc: Mossad agent fakes his death so he can re-emerge in New York City as a hair stylist(n)

programme.title: Friday After Next
programme.desc: The gang from Friday and Next Friday are back in this urban comedy, in which Craig (Ice Cube) and Day-Day (Mike Epps) have finally moved out of their respective parents' homes and gotten an apartment together. However, a bogus neighborhood Santa Claus (Rickey Smiley) decides to help Craig and Day-Day share the wealth by robbing their apartment, and when he rips off their stereo, he also makes off with their rent money, which was hidden in the speaker cabinets. Desperate to make rent and have some money for Christmas presents, Craig and Day-Day land jobs at a local strip mall, where their fathers, Mr. Jones (John Witherspoon) and Uncle Elroy (Don "D.C." Curry), have gone into business together running a barbecue joint. Craig and Day-Day are installed as security guards, and while Craig tries to make time with Donna (K.D. Aubert), a saleswoman at the Pimp N' Ho's Boutique, and keep things orderly at Holy Moly's Doughnut Shop, Day-Day attempts to transform himself into a master of crime-fighting, which causes a lot more problems than it solves. Friday After Next is the first feature film from director Marcus Raboy, who previously directed music videos for Sting, Li'l Kim, Staind, and Friday After Next star Ice Cube(n)

programme.title: The Fifth Element
programme.desc: Billed as one of the most expensive movies ever to come out of Europe, The Fifth Element is a gripping science fiction adventure in which Bruce Willis plays Korben Dallas, a jaded New York cab driver in the 23rd century whose life takes a turn for the dramatic when a beautiful young woman literally falls into his life. Leeloo (Milla Jovovich) is the 'Fifth Element', a being who represents all that is good in the universe. Every 5,000 years, a doorway between two parallel dimensions opens which allows the forces of darkness to strike back at the forces of good in this dimension. Only by assembling the five elements at the crucial moment can the forces of good overcome those of evil - Korben's new-found mission is to protect Leeloo from the evil Zorg (Gary Oldman) and his army of dog-like mercenaries, the Mangalores(n)

programme.title: Black Sheep
programme.desc: Political comedy in which a prospective state governor's election prospects are jeopardised by his wayward younger brother. Expecting his mischievous sibling to be something of a liability during his campaign, the aspiring politician orders one of his aides to keep him out of the public eye - a task he does not relish(n)

programme.title: Pumpkinhead II: Blood Wings
programme.desc: A New York City policeman returns with his family to the small, quiet town of his childhood to escape big city life. His rebellious teenage daughter, however, ends up with the wrong crowd and unknowingly conjures up the remains of Pumpkinhead(n)

programme.title: Freaks of Nature
programme.desc: A town full of humans, zombies, and vampires living in coexistence are thrust into an all-out war when aliens invade in this wild horror comedy. Now, three teens must defeat the newest visitors to restore the peace(n)

programme.title: John Ford Goes to War
programme.desc: In this documentary centered on legendary filmmaker John Ford's cinematic contributions to Allied morale during World War II, actor/musician Kris Kristofferson narrates as the How Green Was My Valley director turns his back on Tinseltown in order to fulfill his patriotic duty. By the time the United States became involved in World War II, John Ford was already a film legend, but when Uncle Sam came calling the veteran filmmaker eagerly packed his bags and set his sites on the frontlines. Though Ford did sustain battlefield injuries during the production of the Oscar-winning documentary The Battle of Midway, the remarkable film endeared him to patriotic American audiences across the country and his next wartime effort, 1943's December 7th, proceeded to earn the filmmaker yet another Oscar. In addition to featuring footage from these and other, lesser-known wartime films from Ford, this documentary also offers an intimate look at the complex filmmaker and explores his remarkable legacy through both archive footage and interviews with such notable directors as Oliver Stone and Peter Bogdanovich(n)

programme.title: Broken Arrow
programme.desc: Terrorists steal nuclear warheads from the U.S. military but don't count on a pilot and park ranger spoiling their plans(n)

programme.title: Hard Luck
programme.desc: Wesley Snipes stars in this twist-filled thriller, which weaves together three converging story lines that center on a former criminal trying to go straight who's forced to go on the run after getting caught up in a drug deal gone bad. Cybill Shepherd, Mario Van Peebles (who also directed), Luis Guzmán(n)

programme.title: Windtalkers
programme.desc: A powerful, true story about members of the Navajo tribe who proudly served the U.S. in WWII as code talkers by using their native language as a code to relay information to military leaders. Unbeknownst to the Navajo is the dark secret that they're to be killed by American soldiers if one of them is in danger of being captured(n)

programme.title: 88 Minutes
programme.desc: Jon Avnet directs Al Pacino in the thriller 88 Minutes. Pacino plays university professor Jack Gramm, who occasionally assists the FBI in matters of forensic psychiatry. His recent testimony against a freshly convicted criminal seems to be the reason he has gotten a scary phone call informing him he will die in 88 minutes. As with the like-minded thriller D.O.A. (both the original and the remake), the protagonist must use his skills in order to track down who has hatched this evil plot and hopefully prevent his own demise. Alicia Witt and Leelee Sobieski co-star as the professor's star students(n)

programme.title: Death Wish
programme.desc: Brutal revenge thriller about a liberal New York architect who takes the law into his own hands after his family is attacked by muggers. Action(n)

programme.title: The Evil Dead
programme.desc: Filled with stomach-churning non-stop violence and gore, this low-budget horror outing has become a cult classic and inspired a pair of imaginative sequels. The story centers on a quintet of college students who go to a mountain cabin to relax during a break. The discovery of an ancient copy of the Sumerian Book of the dead and a tape explaining how to use it causes them to do some experimentation that results in all but one turning into demons and suffering agonizing deaths. Ash, the survivor, then sets off to send the demons back to their resting place(n)

programme.title: Broken Arrow
programme.desc: Terrorists steal nuclear warheads from the U.S. military but don't count on a pilot and park ranger spoiling their plans(n)

programme.title: Kung Fu Hustle
programme.desc: Action flick set in 1940s China, about a wannabe gangster who tries to extort a town in order to impress an outlaw gang(n)

programme.title: Machine Gun Preacher
programme.desc: A former biker and drug dealer single-handedly takes on the nefarious Lord's Resistance Army in a noble bid to save young Sudanese refugees from a life of violence and suffering. Inspired by actual events, Marc Forster's Machine Gun Preacher stars Gerard Butler as Sam Childers, a tough-as-nails biker whose heart shatters upon witnessing the harrowing plight of children in Sudan. Determined that no child shall be enslaved by the brutal Lord's Resistance Army, Childers turns to God for inspiration, and establishes an orphanage for wounded kids and child soldiers. When the Lord's Resistance Army refuses to stand down, Childers organizes a militia to protect the children. In helping to give the orphans of war-torn Sudan a better future, the former outlaw begins to find new meaning in his own life as well(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team must ascertain whether the murder of a Navy officer, whose body was found on a rural road, was the result of a bar fight or because he knew too much about an attack on a fellow female officer. Meanwhile, DiNozzo and McGee begin a juice detox to purge their bodies of impurities. Starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum, Cote de Pablo and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the disappearance of photographer Martin Roe, who was due to testify at an army first lieutenant's court-martial after he captured a picture of what appeared to be a soldier killing an unarmed civilian. However, the photograph is leaked, and Roe is later found dead with a needle in his arm.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Director Vance charges DiNozzo with a special assignment to go to France, locate Admiral Kendall's wayward daughter Amanda and bring her home. Arriving in Marseille, Tony immediately heads to the local NCIS office, only to find five dead agents. After eventually tracking down Amanda, the pair embark on a rollercoaster ride to the relative safety of the nearest NCIS office in Spain. Michael Weatherly stars.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs travels to his home town after hearing news of his father's death, while the team investigates whether a fire on a US Navy ship was accidental or planned. The vessel served as prison to several members of the Brotherhood of Doubt terrorist group, whom Gibbs was responsible for catching. After the blaze, two of those members are missing. Tony argues that Gibbs would want to know, but Vance does not want him disturbed at this difficult time. Mark Harmon stars.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Return of the American drama following the work of the Naval Criminal Investigative Service. Gibbs and McGee travel to Russia to escort a computer expert connected to classified intel. However, the mission is compromised and they are forced to go off the grid while being hunted by Russian mercenaries. Meanwhile, the team in DC frantically tries to locate the missing pair. Mark Harmon and Sean Murray star.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Lisbon and the team examine the murder of a Shakespeare enthusiast and become suspicious of the victim's billionaire employer when he announces a $10million reward for information about the case, despite having a reputation for frugality. Meanwhile, FBI agent Susan Darcy enlists Jane's help to investigate the killing of a woman whose body was found in woods, and their only clue is a piece of glass from a wine bottle. Crime drama, starring Robin Tunney and Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A wealthy man who had cancer is found murdered, despite only having weeks left to live, leaving the team suspecting one of his relatives could be to blame. Jane discovers his son was being cut out of the will and his wife was pretending to be ill in a con to win the affections of rich men. He is also led to a charlatan healer selling a special kind of tea after noticing an unusual smell on the body. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A casino security guard is killed and the team investigates his place of work, leading Jane to meet a magician he used to work with. He discovers his former colleague is planning to rob the business because his girlfriend has been kidnapped, and sets up a daring robbery as part of a live show in the hope of learning the murderer's identity. Crime drama, guest starring Christopher Judge, with Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A popular teacher is found murdered and the team discovers hate mail in his bag. However, as the investigation gets under way, the agents discover the victim's behaviour had always been immaculate, ruling out any wrongdoing when traces of drugs are found in his car and a pupil accuses him of sleeping with a prostitute. Jane focuses on the relationship between the director of the school play and the lead actor, and even performs as an understudy to unravel more details about the crime. Starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Female impersonators come under suspicion when a man is found burnt to death on a cabaret bar's doorstep, but as Jane and the team investigate, they discover the victim was being bullied by more than one person, forcing them to try to lure the killer into the open. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: The TAC helps a woman fight a drug patent lawsuit, but the case takes the group to Callisto, the Texan town where Bull suffered the only trial loss of his career.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A US Marine sergeant falls to her death from a building, and when Gibbs and his team examine the circumstances, the woman's doctor urges him to consider this a murder investigation.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A navy lieutenant is murdered during a `tiger cruise', during which sailors' friends and relatives are invited aboard military vessels to spend the night on their ship.(n)

programme.title: Shots Fired
programme.desc: The district attorney assigns a new team to the case, but Preston remains determined to personally uncover the truth.(n)

programme.title: Baskets
programme.desc: Dale's dog days seem to be coming to an end, and Christine finally returns to Bakersfield.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Mayor West raises the drinking age to 50, leaving Brian - thanks to dog years - the only one old enough to buy alcohol for Peter.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Steve is kidnapped and taken to the North Pole, where Father Christmas has assembled a workforce made up of children to mine for precious stones to use in an ancient ritual.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Fr Donovan organises a Christmas play at the shopping centre, and casts Stan as Santa Claus and Roger as Jesus - but they land themselves in trouble after getting into a fight with each other. Elsewhere, Hayley and Jeff adopt a child, who turns out to be possessed.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Lois shows Meg how to have fun during a spring break at the beach, while Peter rashly takes out a loan and buys a boat, determined to try his hand at commercial fishing.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: The Griffins visit Lois's pregnant sister and help deliver her baby, who catches them off guard by putting in a premature appearance. Exhilarated, they decide to try for another child of their own - but Stewie is horrified and tries every trick in the book to prevent conception.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: The Smiths plan a game night and Roger makes excuses about other engagements - until he is caught out by his lies and has to admit that he has been spending time with another family.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Langley Falls implements a ban on certain fats, making Stan's favourite foods illegal. Unable to resist, he flouts the law and heads for Mexico to stock up on illicit goodies. Meanwhile, Roger helps Klaus claim an inheritance.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.sub-title: To Love and Die in Dixie.
programme.desc: Chris identifies a thief in a police line-up, making the Griffins very unpopular with the criminal fraternity - and forcing them to move to a backwoods town in the South for their own protection. Animated adventures, with the voices of Seth MacFarlane and Seth Green.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: The family visits Lois's parents, where Peter thinks he may finally be winning the approval of his father-in-law - until Brian falls in love with the Pewterschmidts' dog Sea Breeze and allows his heart to lead him into trouble.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter discovers he has an African-American ancestor and his efforts to embrace his new-found heritage end with his demanding reparation from Lois's family. Meanwhile, Stewie tries to find out how cheerleaders control men's minds.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter tries to rebuild a dispirited Joe's self-confidence by helping him train for the decathlon at the Paralympics - a daunting task made easier by the occasional discreet dose of steroids. Meanwhile, Stewie, Chris and Meg argue over $26 they find at a charity car wash.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan forgets to buy grenadine at the grocery store, so an enraged Roger takes revenge by replacing him as chairman of the Homeowners' Association - and starts to abuse his own power. With the neighbourhood's American identity under threat, the spy enlists the help of his children to regain control of the community.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Steve asks Stan to join him in a father-son bike tournament, but discovers he has never learnt to ride a bicycle. Meanwhile, Roger hires Hayley to work in a makeshift bar that he has opened in the attic.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: A two-year-old boy finds a severed finger and presents it to the police, triggering a murder investigation. Adrian volunteers to take temporary care of the youngster - and demonstrates a surprising flair for fatherhood. Detective drama, starring Tony Shalhoub.(n)

Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.sub-title: So Long and Thanks for All the Red Snapper.
programme.desc: While investigating the murder of a surfer, Lisbon reconnects with her ex-fiance, whom she has not seen for more than a decade, and Cho questions whether he should be in a relationship with Summer. Crime drama, starring Robin Tunney, Tim Kang and Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane is consumed by memories of his wife and daughter as the eighth anniversary of their deaths arrives. To make matters worse, he is taunted by Red John, the serial killer he blames for their murders, and his lapse in concentration jeopardises Lisbon's latest case - as well as his position within the CBI. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda races to the scene of three murders, but when she arrives the bodies are nowhere to be found. To solve the case, the team must first locate the victims before the hunt for the killer can begin. Detective drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda investigates the death of a teenager who was due to appear in court to testify that a man convicted of murdering a Korean couple was not actually the culprit. However, several unexpected twists in the case make her wonder whether the boy was really going to tell the truth. Meanwhile, disaster strikes when Pope's ex-wife exposes one of his past relationships. Kyra Sedgwick stars.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: The wife of a crime boss is murdered in FBI custody. Brenda suspects the agent supposedly protecting her was corrupt and hastily tries to interrogate him before the FBI can regain control of the investigation. As the case unfolds, the team learns today's Mafia do not follow the traditional rules any more. Detective drama series, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Part one of two. Brenda takes involuntary leave, but ends up assisting an investigation into a murder linked to a terrorist group, while Commander Taylor takes advantage of her enforced layoff to try to break up the PHD. Crime drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: NCIS

programme.title: NCIS

programme.desc: Generally telecast on the weekend late-night schedule, the half-hour Whacked Out Sports was a reality "clip" show devoted to unusual sports activities and embarrassing bloopers. The series' specialty seemed to be spotlighting eccentric contestants indulging in offbeat sports events with bizarre rules. In each market that the series played, viewers were invited to send in video clips of "crazy stuff never seen on TV" -- especially if "hot girls" were involved (that's what it said on the press release!). programme.desc: The Crepes of Wrath. A little story about how Bart saves France after blowing up Principal Skinner's mom with a cherry bomb. Voices include Tress Mac Neille, Nancy Cartwright, Harry Shearer, Dan Castellaneta, Julie Kavner(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Way We Was. Marge and Homer reveal how they met as they tell a tale of love at first sight (but only for one) and the high-school prom they attended (but not together). Voices: Julie Kavner, Dan Castellaneta, Harry Shearer, Yeardley Smith(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer at the Bat. Homer signs up for the nuclear power plant's softball team(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Last Exit to Springfield. Homer stands up for what he believes in. Featuring the guest voice of Dr Joyce Brothers as herself(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: $pringfield (Or, How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love Legalized Gambling)
programme.desc: $pringfield (Or, How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love Legalized Gambling). Legalized gambling comes to Springfield, and Marge becomes addicted; Robert Goulet entertains at Bart's casino for kids. Julie Kavner, Harry Shearer(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa on Ice. Lisa and Bart go head-to-head in an exciting hockey match(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart on the Road. Bart drives Milhouse, Martin and Nelson to Tennessee, thanks to his fake ID and Martin's cash from a stock dividend. Voices: Nancy Cartwright, Pamela Hayden, Russi Taylor(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: My Sister, My Sitter. Lisa starts a new career as a babysitter, and all is going well until Marge and Homer employ her to look after Bart and Maggie..(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Trouble With Trillions. During a tax audit, Homer strikes an unusual deal---he agrees to work for the FBI and to recover a trillion-dollar bill embezzled by Mr. Burns. Voices: Dan Castellaneta, Harry Shearer, Hank Azaria, Julie Kavner, Nancy Cartwright(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Mom and Pop Art. Homer pursues a career as an artist when his misshapen barbecue pit attracts the attention of a gallery. Featuring the guest voices of Isabella Rossellini and Jasper Johns(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Saddlesore Gallactica. Homer and Bart save a horse from the fair and decide to train him as an American footballer. Or maybe a racehorse. They give him a Dennis Rodman-style makeover, christen him Furious D and get into trouble with magical elf jockeys(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Children of a Lesser Clod. Homer opens a day-care center in the house, prompting envy in Lisa and Bart when he treats other kids better than he treats them. Yeardley Smith, Dan Castellaneta, Nancy Cartwright(n)

programme.title: The Sitter
programme.desc: Irresponsible babysitter Noah takes a trip to New York City with his three young charges in order to visit a woman who promises to have sex with him in exchange for drugs, but soon the group are pursued by a pair of drug dealers(n)

programme.title: The Wackiest Ship in the Army
programme.desc: A naval officer is given the command of an old sailing ship to undertake a very important mission - to transport an Australian agent into enemy waters so he can spy on the Japanese. However, he finds the ship is falling apart at the seams and is manned by a crew that does not know how to sail her. Second World War comedy, with Jack Lemmon, Ricky Nelson, John Lund, Chips Rafferty and Tom Tully.(n)

programme.title: Ice Age: Dawn of the Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Sid the sloth discovers three eggs - but when they hatch into dinosaurs, he struggles to keep them under control. The creatures' mother comes looking for her offspring and takes them and Sid to an underground world where the giant reptiles never became extinct. Sid's friends, aided by a crazed one-eyed weasel, head for this strange new land to rescue him. Animated adventure sequel, with the voices of John Leguizamo, Denis Leary, Ray Romano and Simon Pegg.(n)

programme.title: Carry On Spying
programme.desc: A secret formula is stolen by a sinister organisation masterminded by the evil Dr Crow. The British government plans to assign its top agents to deal with the crisis, but owing to staff shortages, has to settle for a bungling spy and his three hapless trainees. Comedy, starring Kenneth Williams, Charles Hawtrey, Barbara Windsor, Bernard Cribbins, Jim Dale, Eric Barker and Victor Maddern.(n)

programme.title: The Jewel of the Nile
programme.desc: A novelist travels to the Middle East to become a sheik's official biographer, only to end up being held hostage by him. Her lover joins forces with an old enemy to rescue her, but they get drawn into the hunt for a mysterious ancient treasure that has a connection to an eccentric holy man. Comedy adventure sequel to Romancing the Stone, starring Michael Douglas, Kathleen Turner and Danny DeVito.(n)

programme.title: Grease
programme.desc: Rebellious American teenager Danny falls for innocent Australian girl Sandy during the summer holidays, but when he later finds out she is a new student at his school, he risks losing her love by trying to act cool in front of his friends. Romantic musical set in the 1950s, starring John Travolta, Olivia Newton-John, Stockard Channing, Jeff Conaway, Didi Conn and Sid Caesar.(n)

programme.title: War of the Planet of the Apes Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Matt Reeves and star Andy Serkis talk about making the third film in the series.(n)

programme.title: Men in Black 3
programme.desc: An alien criminal escapes from a prison on the moon and goes back in time on a mission of revenge, changing the course of history. Agent J of the top-secret Earth defence organisation follows him back to 1969, and joins forces with a younger version of his mentor Agent K to set things right. Sci-fi comedy sequel, starring Will Smith, Josh Brolin and Tommy Lee Jones.(n)

programme.title: Machete Kills
programme.desc: The relentless Mexican mercenary is hired by the president of the United States for a vitally important mission. A billionaire arms dealer intends to start a nuclear war using a space-based weapon of mass destruction, but defeating his schemes involves a deadly encounter with a murderous master of disguise. Action thriller sequel, starring Danny Trejo and Mel Gibson.(n)

programme.title: Lunacy
programme.desc: A man plagued by horrific nightmares of going mad is travelling home from his mother's funeral when an aristocrat offers him a place to stay for the night. He is soon dragged into a disturbing ritual and faces being `cured' of his dreams by being sent to an asylum where the patients' delusions are given free rein. Satirical horror, starring Pavel Liska and Jan Triska. In Czech.(n)

programme.title: First Men in the Moon
programme.desc: An eccentric Victorian inventor discovers a strange material that defies gravity and uses it to build the world's first spaceship. Leading an expedition to the moon, he is astonished to discover it is inhabited by giant ants and caterpillar-like creatures. Sci-fi adventure based on HG Wells' novel, starring Lionel Jeffries, Edward Judd, Martha Hyer and Miles Malleson, with special effects by Ray Harryhausen.(n)

programme.title: Arabian Nights
programme.desc: The story of two half-brothers - one the heroic caliph, the other an evil usurper - as they do battle for the right to rule their kingdom, and win the hand of beautiful dancer Sherazade. Adaptation of the classic adventure tales, starring Jon Hall, Maria Montez, Sabu and Leif Erickson.(n)

programme.title: Beau Geste
programme.desc: Three brothers are accused of stealing from their aristocratic adopted mother. They seek to salvage their honour by joining the foreign legion, battling a rampaging Arab army as well as coming into conflict with their sadistic commanding officer. Action adventure, starring Gary Cooper, Ray Milland, Robert Preston and Brian Donlevy.(n)

programme.title: Halls of Montezuma
programme.desc: A US Marine unit fighting in the Pacific is ordered to capture Japanese troops so they can be interrogated for information about a new weapons base - but the mission proves even more difficult than expected. Second World War adventure, starring Richard Widmark, Jack Palance, Reginald Gardiner, Robert Wagner and Karl Malden.(n)

programme.title: Airplane II: The Sequel
programme.desc: Hapless hero Ted Striker tries to prevent the launch of a passenger space shuttle, certain it will end in disaster. Sadly, his prediction comes true when a computer malfunction sends the spacecraft hurtling toward the sun, while a man driven mad by sexual inadequacy smuggles a bomb on board. Disaster movie spoof sequel, starring Robert Hays, Julie Hagerty, Lloyd Bridges, William Shatner, Sonny Bono and Chad Everett.(n)

programme.title: The Drop
programme.desc: A Brooklyn bartender secretly provides a service delivering shipments of money to local gangsters. His criminal connections lead to his involvement in a robbery that goes disastrously wrong and digs up the long-buried secrets from his neighbourhood's past. Crime drama based on a short story by Dennis Lehane, starring Tom Hardy, Noomi Rapace and James Gandolfini in his final film role.(n)

programme.title: Lawless
programme.desc: Three brothers run an underground bootlegging operation in Depression-era Virginia. However, as their criminal activities become increasingly successful, a corrupt deputy sheriff demands a cut of the profits, forcing them to fight to defend their livelihood. Crime drama, starring Shia LaBeouf, Tom Hardy, Jason Clarke, Gary Oldman and Guy Pearce.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten prepares steak au poivre and strawberry tarts.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten prepares a goat's cheese salad and a sour cream and coffee cake.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: US chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten prepares a full meal for her LA friends, but tricks them into thinking they will get nothing more than thin soup and wilting greens.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten prepares a supper and breakfast for her husband before she goes away for the night.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree celebrates her middle children with a week of food and fun while the others are away, making cornmeal pancakes with blueberry syrup, chicken alfredo and grilled fruit pizzas.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond's raids the pantry, and makes a fragrant chickpea curry with rice, then for sweet treats in a hurry, no-bake peanut butter bars save the day.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond's father-in-law, Chuck, is spearheading a big fence fixing project on the ranch, so Ree is saying thank you by delivering him and his crew a Tex-Mex lunch.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond's cooks hearty breakfast biscuits that her husband and son are coming to collect on their way to feed the cattle.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef explains the value of pickling and preserving home-grown produce and explains why knowledge of these processes has been of vital importance throughout history. He goes on to demonstrate the procedure by pickling courgettes with mint and chilli, as well as aubergines with garlic and oregano.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver prepares simple recipes using tomatoes and demonstrates how even the tiniest balcony or backyard can be used to grow fruit and vegetables. He also creates an oven-baked sausage ragu and seasonal salad, before mixing up a pale pink tomato and vodka consomme.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver creates a selection of dishes with the bumper crop of courgettes he has grown in his garden, including a salad and a recipe that involves deep-frying and stuffing the edible flowers. He also shows how the vegetable can be served as an accompaniment to grilled mackerel.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver provides tips on hosting a barbecue and demonstrates simple rules that guarantee properly cooked food every time. He also shows the best ways to cook everything on the grill, including chicken, ribs and shellfish, before revealing his recipe for the perfect marinade.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver cooks three dishes to show the versatility of beans, using legumes he picked from his garden - home-made baked borlotti beans, a hearty runner bean stew and a marinated French bean salad.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Ministry of Food
programme.desc: With his campaign slowly failing to revolutionise the diets of Rotherham residents, Jamie Oliver seeks advice from wartime cooking guru Marguerite Patton, who was once a part of the original Ministry of Food. programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a farmer's market in Memphis that serves meatloaf, sloppy Joes and catfish.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: Willie Degal visits the Lexington Grille and Pub in Bardonia, New York where he attempts to save the restaurant from a total collapse by reigning in the out-of-control staff.(n)

programme.desc: Willie Degel visits Mt. Ivy Cafe in Pomona, New York, and discovers that is may be the owner, rather than the staff, causing problems.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy indulges himself on righteously rich recipes in Charlotte, North Carolina, and Los Angeles.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy visits a Korean-Mexican mash-up and in Chinatown, a New Orleans-inspired joint. Then he heads to Charlotte, North Carolina, and a Serbian pizza place.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri makes stops in North Carolina and California as he tastes some killer collard greens and turkey chilli.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri enjoys the taste of the Far East. In Las Vegas, he samples a Japanese spot that prepares sushi and traditional udon, and in Denver he visits a Korean joint.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri heads to Denver, where he tries Indian and Brazilian specialties. Then, in Atlanta, he finds time for some good old American comfort food: meat sandwiches.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives

programme.desc: Na Garten prepares a series of recipes with fruit as the main ingredient.(n)

programme.desc: A mozzarella masterclass with a local cheese maker, and an Italian-inspired feast.(n)

programme.desc: Na Garten shares her vegetable based recipes for main courses, starters, salads and side-dishes.(n)

programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at what some chefs cook when they get home after work, with quick and easy recipes.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Fresh
programme.desc: Chef Anna Olson auctions off her lunch-cooking services at a lakeside home.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Fresh
programme.desc: Chef Anna Olson heads to a baby shower she is hosting, with appetisers and desserts including goat's cheese truffles, cornbread muffins with baby shrimp salad, and baby cherry pies.(n)

programme.desc: Can Ezra and Julie help Judi Parsons reduce her menu and get her back on the ice with her fishing friends.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond prepares a prairie picnic for friends, with chicken Milanese Mediterranean orzo salad, cold roasted veggies with herby yogurt dip, and pina colada tres leches cakes.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond prepares sides for the Thanksgiving feast, including broccoli wild rice casserole, sweet 'taters, and dressing with Brussels sprouts.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: The Drummonds celebrate the completion of their new office with a shrimp cocktail bar with three sauces, plus spicy Italian meatballs, bacon wrapped dates and sweet brownie pops.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond prepares brunch for three generations of Drummond girls, including maple oat nut scones, a cowgirl quiche, and champagne oranges.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Cake Wars
programme.desc: Four bakers go head-to-head to create chocolate centrepieces for a Valentine's Day wine tasting event, with world famous chocolatier Jonathan Grahm as the guest judge.(n)

programme.title: Real Girl's Kitchen
programme.desc: Haylie prepares barbecue pineapple pizza for the children to decorate with fresh veggies, as well as sliced apple cookies with salted dark chocolate almond butter.(n)

programme.title: Real Girl's Kitchen
programme.desc: Haylie prepares a Spanish-themed feast, including a dulce de leche cake and a birthday breakfast of farro cakes and strawberry crostinis, for her mother's birthday.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates the versatility of pastry as he prepares a variety of sweet and savoury recipes using pastry along with home-grown fruit and vegetables from his Essex garden. The chef shows how to create an Italian ham, nettle and spinach tart, a pie made with steak, Guinness and cheese, plus a traditional apple and blackberry pie.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver turns his attention to dishes using eggs collected from his hand-reared free-range hens. He creates a home-made tagliatelle, an omelette salad with bresaola, and a meringue with hot pears and chocolate sauce. He also starts some former battery hens off on their journey to a free-range life.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The first of the London and South East heats sees returning contender Adam Simmonds and newcomers Tom Sellers and Adam Byatt prepare their starters for the D-Day banquet. They must impress a mystery Great British Menu veteran if they are to cook in the regional final for judges Prue Leith, Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and Joy Hunter, who worked in Winston Churchill's war cabinet as a secretary.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The London and South East chefs prepare seafood courses, with Adam Byatt hoping for inspiration from a visit to his grandmother's house to find out about his grandfather's military connections. There is also a surprise appearance in the kitchen by Tom Sellers' mentor and former Great British Menu champion Tom Aikens.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond makes roasted lemon chicken legs, Mexican macaroni salad, watermelon pico de gallo and brown sugar oatmeal cookies for a pet parade and potluck pinic.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond makes her favourite comfort food, including chicken and dumplings, quesadillas with shrimp and peppers, pasta with tomato cream sauce and cinnamon toast.(n)

programme.title: Chopped Junior
programme.desc: Spin-off from the cookery competition featuring young contestants.(n)

programme.title: Man Finds Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman searches for more secret eats in Mexico City, where he tries lamb barbacoa cooked underground at a restaurant hidden in an ancient cave.(n)

programme.title: Man Finds Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman explores Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, sampling a spicy burger and going on a nature hike that ends in the best grilled seafood in the city.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates the versatility of rhubarb, a plant that has been neglected in the UK even though the country produces some of the best crops in the world. The chef uses it as a foundation for a hot and sour dish with crispy pork and noodles, a ginger souffle and a creamy cocktail drink.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef reveals three simple ways to cook and dress asparagus, and demonstrates how best to use the vegetable in a meal. Gardener Brian also explains that once established, asparagus practically takes care of itself and can last for up to 20 years.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's American Road Trip
programme.desc: Crusading chef Jamie Oliver meets former gangsters, cowboys and high-society women as he embarks on a culinary journey to discover the heart and soul of America. programme.title: The Piglet Files
programme.desc: Peter develops a gambling and drinking problems as part of a ploy by Drummond to find out whether Maxwell is a mole for the KGB.(n)

programme.title: The Piglet Files
programme.desc: Peter ends up babysitting a thief when Drummond releases the criminal from jail in an attempt for MI5 to beat MI6 at a safe-cracking operation.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Second Husband and the Showgirls.
programme.desc: Tom and Smiler arrange an interesting blind date and Truly discovers his ex-wife's new husband is coming to town. Frank Thornton and Stephen Lewis star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Cupid's arrow targets Truly when a woman from his past returns with amorous intentions, so everyone lends a hand in liberating him. Frank Thornton, Peter Sallis and Brian Murphy star in the last episode to feature Thora Hird as Edie Pegden.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Barry wins a competition - but when the prize proves more trouble than it is worth, it spells disaster for him and everyone who helps him try to get rid of it. Mike Grady stars.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Chaos abounds at an annual parade held to celebrate a famous battle. The lifelike effigy of the old General has been spruced up and Nora Batty prepares to sit on a float playing the part of his wife. Norman Wisdom makes a cameo appearance.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch desperately wants to get out of the tedious task of making fishing nets, and hatches a crafty scheme to get himself assigned to the library. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The inmates face a day of hard labour digging drains on a lonely stretch of moorland. However, Fletcher soon finds a way of turning the situation to his advantage. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher takes on the role of agony aunt and ends up writing letters home for his fellow inmates - but he soon discovers domestic problems of his own when his daughter brings bad news on visiting day. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Patricia Brake.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The disappearance of an illicit tin of pineapple chunks leaves the inmates horrified that there is a thief in their midst - and for a while, no one is above suspicion. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber is feeling dejected after his romantic fortunes take a turn for the worse, so Fletch tries to revive his friend's flagging spirits. However, his cunning plan has one potential drawback - it involves his own daughter. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: A squeak on Granville's bike interferes with his hopes of romance, and Arkwright worries about a mysterious visitor to a house in Atkinson Terrace. Comedy, with Ronnie Barker, David Jason and Lynda Baron.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.sub-title: How to Ignite Your Errand Boy.
programme.desc: Arkwright decides to make his own product, unhappy at the amount of profit lost to middlemen, and instructs Granville to come up with a suitable idea for something that is in daily demand, yet cheap and simple to make. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright is reluctant to prise open his wallet and buy a new suit, until Nurse Gladys Emmanuel gives him an incentive. Roy Clarke's classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker, David Jason and Lynda Baron.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright decides to expand his empire by opening a mobile shop in a bid to impress Nurse Gladys Emmanuel, but the enterprise is cut short by Granville's close encounter with some perishables. Comedy, with Ronnie Barker, David Jason and Lynda Baron.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright is embarrassed after losing his trousers on the way to the wedding of Nurse Gladys Emmanuel's niece. Roy Clarke's classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Lynda Baron.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright invents a saint's day as a pretext for checking the pockets of a foreign visitor suspected of shoplifting. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright tries to improve the sale of an overstocked commodity with incredible efficiency, and Granville's lust for power leads to disaster. Roy Clarke's comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: A squeak on Granville's bike interferes with his hopes of romance, and Arkwright worries about a mysterious visitor to a house in Atkinson Terrace. Comedy, with Ronnie Barker, David Jason and Lynda Baron.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.sub-title: How to Ignite Your Errand Boy.
programme.desc: Arkwright decides to make his own product, unhappy at the amount of profit lost to middlemen, and instructs Granville to come up with a suitable idea for something that is in daily demand, yet cheap and simple to make. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.sub-title: Fig Biscuits and Inspirational Toilet Rolls.
programme.desc: Miser Arkwright decides to open the shop before dawn to catch the morning rush and fleece more unsuspecting customers. Roy Clarke's classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: The Royle Family
programme.desc: The wedding is put at risk after Denise kicks up a stink and accuses Dave of a heinous crime - flirting with Beverley Macca. Comedy, starring Caroline Aherne, Sue Johnston and Ricky Tomlinson.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Agnes goes on a diet after her family's comments about her weight, but soon realises how difficult it will be to lay off the fish and chips. Cathy's new partner seems more interested in her mother when he visits the Brown household, and Rory has a professional dilemma after he discovers illegal drugs at work.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Jack Whitehall, Josh Widdicombe and Shappi Khorsandi.
programme.desc: Jack Whitehall guest-hosts the stand-up show recorded at London's Hammersmith Apollo, inviting comedians to share their light-hearted views on modern life. Tonight he introduces routines by Josh Widdicombe and Shappi Khorsandi.(n)

programme.title: Men Behaving Badly
programme.desc: Tony sneaks into Deborah's flat while she is out, and causes chaos when he cannot resist a peek in her underwear drawer. Dorothy feels her biological clock ticking away, but debates whether Gary is mature enough to be a father. Comedy, starring Martin Clunes, Neil Morrissey, Caroline Quentin and Leslie Ash.(n)

programme.title: Men Behaving Badly
programme.desc: A jealous Gary suspects Dorothy is having an affair and sets out to prove it. Tony tries to wangle his way into Deborah's affections by demonstrating the caring side of his personality. Comedy, starring Martin Clunes, Neil Morrissey, Leslie Ash and Caroline Quentin.(n)

programme.title: Inside No 9
programme.desc: The return of the anthology of darkly comic tales in which each episode explores the goings-on behind a door marked No 9. On board the overnight service from Paris to Bourg St Maurice, a motley collection of passengers tries to get a quiet night's sleep as the train makes its way across France. But as the sleeping compartment fills up, the chances of that begin to look highly unlikely. Written by and starring Steve Pemberton and Reece Shearsmith, with Julie Hesmondhalgh, Mark Benton and Jack Whitehall.(n)

programme.title: Inside No 9
programme.desc: Christine Clarke brings a man back to her flat from a New Year's Eve party and her life immediately starts to unravel. Who is the terrifying stranger who keeps appearing in the apartment at night? Darkly comic tale by Steve Pemberton and Reece Shearsmith, starring Sheridan Smith, Tom Riley and Michele Dotrice.(n)

programme.title: Brian Pern
programme.sub-title: Brian Pern: A Life In Rock.
programme.desc: To mark the very convoluted anniversary of the non-release of his unheard debut solo LP Brian Pern's Musical Version of The Day of the Triffids, the musician plans to stage the entire album live from the summit of Mount Kilimanjaro with a host of special guests. The groundbreaking show not only reveals the technical challenges of performing live music, but also the physical strains facing the ageing rock stars of Brian's generation. Spoof music documentary, starring Simon Day, Michael Kitchen, Paul Whitehouse and Nigel Havers, with cameo appearances by Roger Moore, Dan Snow and Tim Rice.(n)

programme.title: Brian Pern
programme.sub-title: Brian Pern: A Life In Rock.
programme.desc: The musician records a charity record in aid of bi-polar polar bears, but there are conditions from his label about its content. He must make the album commercial, Christmassy and full of cutting-edge duets with big stars - none of which comes easy to him. Meanwhile, Brian's health problems also come to a head after he learns he has invested millions into an aggressive tax-avoidance scheme and HIM Revenue & Customs wants its money back. Spoof music documentary, starring Simon Day, with Anna Maxwell Martin and Roger Allam.(n)

programme.title: The Thick of It
programme.desc: Armando Iannucci's political satire returns with long-suffering MP Peter Mannion taking charge at the Department of Social Affairs and Citizenship as part of a coalition government. However, he must also work with junior minister Fergus Williams - an arrangement neither man is enjoying. As the series begins, Fergus excitedly prepares to launch his new digital education initiative - until Downing Street spin doctor Stewart Pearson announces technophobe Peter is going to be the spokesman for it instead. Elsewhere in the department, civil servant Terri Coverley tries to ensure she is put up for redundancy, while her colleague Glenn Cullen attempts to make his presence felt. Starring Roger Allam, Geoffrey Streatfeild, Vincent Franklin and Joanna Scanlan.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: The Piglet Files
programme.desc: MI5 are invited to the Vishwani government's embassy - but terrorists besiege the building, leaving the agents attempting to save the day.(n)

programme.title: The Piglet Files
programme.sub-title: The Hunt for the Red Decoder.
programme.desc: A full-scale search is organised for a missing piece of Russian decoding equipment - which has mysteriously turned up at Peter's house.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin plans an afternoon of activities for an elderly friend and her cronies, but he reckons without Paul's interference. Richard Briers, Penelope Wilton and Peter Egan star.(n)

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: Gordon's life appears to be in danger, with a potential assassin apparently stalking the leisure centre. However, he is far more concerned with addressing the facility's falling attendance figures. Chris Barrie stars.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Plenty of Room in the Back.
programme.desc: After concluding she needs a new means of transport, Auntie Wainwright sends Tom and Smiler on a mission to collect her new vehicle - but it doesn't quite live up to their expectations. Jean Alexander, Tom Owen and Stephen Lewis star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Second Stag Night of Doggy Wilkinson.
programme.desc: Eric Sykes guest stars as absent-minded Doggy, who is disappointed when his stag night fails to live up to his expectations. However, Clegg, Truly, Alvin and Entwistle come up with a solution and soon rectify the situation. With Peter Sallis, Frank Thornton and Brian Murphy.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: An innocuous section of woodland soon becomes a legendary site renowned for its ghostly activity, due to the inventive rumours put about by Alvin, Truly and Clegg. Long-running comedy, starring Peter Sallis, Frank Thornton and Brian Murphy.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin plans an afternoon of activities for an elderly friend and her cronies, but he reckons without Paul's interference. Richard Briers, Penelope Wilton and Peter Egan star.(n)

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: Gordon's life appears to be in danger, with a potential assassin apparently stalking the leisure centre. However, he is far more concerned with addressing the facility's falling attendance figures. Chris Barrie stars.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher takes on the role of agony aunt and ends up writing letters home for his fellow inmates - but he soon discovers domestic problems of his own when his daughter brings bad news on visiting day. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Patricia Brake.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Miserly shopkeeper Arkwright organises a sales drive in a bid to boost profits - and rid himself of the vast consignment of apples he has mistakenly ordered. An unhappy Granville is persuaded to demonstrate the merchandise. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: Return of the sitcom about a British Pakistani family in Sparkhill, Birmingham, whose father sees himself as a pillar of the community - even if nobody else does. Mr Khan is lumbered with looking after his mother-in-law, until a miracle happens - she announces she wants to move into a home. The head of a local care centre arrives, plans are made and Khan is over the moon - until he realises his elderly relative is worth quite a bit of money. Can he stop her leaving after all? Adil Ray, Shobu Kapoor and Maya Sondhi star, with a guest appearance from Sally Lindsay.(n)

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: Basil's belief that guests are an obstacle to the smooth running of his hotel is borne out by the arrival of an aggressive woman (Joan Sanderson), and the tension between the two leads to a series of increasingly heated arguments. Classic comedy, starring John Cleese, Prunella Scales, Andrew Sachs and Connie Booth.(n)

programme.sub-title: Plenty of Room in the Back.
