programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Brigitte arranges a blind date for Janey with a wealthy patient's handsome son and feels obliged to deliver the birds-and-bees speech, but ends up learning a bit herself. Meanwhile, Nick pursues his own research and decides to become an artist - with the prospect of nude models in the house high on his list of priorities.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Agnes goes on a diet after her family's comments about her weight, but soon realises how difficult it will be to lay off the fish and chips. Cathy's new partner seems more interested in her mother when he visits the Brown household, and Rory has a professional dilemma after he discovers illegal drugs at work.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The day of the wedding arrives and Bryn is still behaving oddly around Stacey's brother. Nessa debates whether to share her big secret and Smithy resolves to give a superb best man's speech - but finds himself overcome with emotion under the spotlight. Mathew Horne and Joanna Page star.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Comedian Jo Brand hosts the stand-up show from the Hammersmith Apollo, introducing guest Michael McIntyre. Topics discussed include Simon Cowell and football referees.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: Jeremy organises a magic mushroom party in the hope of seducing his ex-girlfriend, but his plans are threatened when Mark returns from work with gastric flu. Things go from bad to worse as Super Hans wrecks the toilet door - and the builder they contact does not seem as reliable as they would like. Robert Webb and David Mitchell star.(n)

programme.title: The Young Ones
programme.desc: Drastic measures are called for when the students are broke and Vyvyan claims to be pregnant, so Neil is forced to join the police to support them.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Mediterranean Escapes
programme.desc: The chef samples Mediterranean food and visits his favourite places in the region. In the first programme he catches a ferry to the mountainous island of Corsica, where he tastes sausages and sheep's cheese, and discovers the locals have a passion for chestnuts.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Mediterranean Escapes
programme.desc: The chef continues to explore his favourite locations in the Mediterranean, visiting a lagoon in Sardinia where he watches fishermen catching mullet using ancient Roman methods. He also boards a ferry heading for the city of Palermo in Sicily and discovers one of the most impressive pasta dishes of his career.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Mediterranean Escapes
programme.desc: The chef experiences the bustling and colourful fish market in the Sicilian city of Catania and discovers dishes developed through centuries of poverty in Puglia on Italy's mainland. However, he is shocked to wake up one morning to find his vehicle is missing.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall recounts his initiation into the rural Dorset community around River Cottage, recalling examples of warm hospitality enjoyed both at home and at more formal venues. He also gives hints on entertaining River Cottage-style.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall emphasises the need for smallholders to be wily entrepreneurs, always ready to barter and haggle, recalling the local farmers' market where he used to sell the excess of the year's harvest and had a run-in with a traffic warden.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall recounts the steep learning curve he mastered in keeping poultry, from first acquiring hens to teaching them to climb his fox-proof coop, and his subsequent attempts to breed the tastiest roasting chicken in the country.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall recalls his attempts at local crafts, from hedge-laying and charcoal-making to more bizarre pursuits such as mouse-charming and the Dorset sport of pumpkin-guddling. He also remembers his entry into a beach sculpture competition, which saw him cover himself in dead fish.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall recalls the opportunities offered by the local rivers and sea, from fishing for tasty treats such as crabs, eels, cuttlefish and pike, to the chance of escaping his smallholding for a waterside adventure. He also reveals the practicalities and benefits of making seaweed fertiliser.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall recounts how he revelled in his Dorset surroundings and learned to feed himself using wildlife in the area. He reveals how wild food became a staple in his diet when he discovered the thrill of hunting rabbits, pigeons and roe deer.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall considers his future at River Cottage. He looks back to his early days of pasture management and caring for animals, and examines the true test of any smallholder's mettle - the slaughter.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.sub-title: The View from River Cottage: Growing Your Own.
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall looks back at his time in Dorset, which began modestly and developed into a major quest for self-sufficiency. He offers tips on the six main ingredients for leading the simple life, beginning by stressing the importance of fresh-killed meat and home-grown fruit and vegetables.(n)

programme.desc: Adam Liaw visits Queensland, where he samples produce including crabs, watermelon, feijoas and macadamias.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The last two semi-finalists work a shift under chef Sat Bains at his two Michelin-starred restaurant in Nottingham, before recreating one of the establishment's signature dishes of pickled and sauteed mushrooms and braised oxtail with watercress panna cotta and chive beurre noisette. They then face a third test in which they must use what they have learnt from their experience to cook a main course and a dessert for Michel Roux Jr and Monica Galetti, with only one contestant progressing to the final round.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The contestants are tasked with creating signature buns from their home regions, before Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins reveal the latest technical challenge - recreating Paul Hollywood's recipe for jam doughnuts. The showstopper task sees them baking an enriched dough loaf fit for a grand celebration, before the judges decide which bakers haven't quite risen to the challenge. From 2012.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: After six weeks of heats, 60 hopefuls have been whittled down to the most promising six. Now it's the first of the semi-finals, in which they face a big catering challenge - in Albert Square of all places. The busy EastEnders cast and crew have strictly one hour for lunch and their schedule is tight, so the two teams - serving 60 main courses and 60 desserts each from specially constructed tents - cannot be late. After that challenge it's back to the studio to come up with their own refined dish, before Gregg Wallace and John Torode send one of the hopefuls home.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers: Mums Know Best
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers investigate the nation's favourite pre-bedtime meals, discovering a recipe for a Portuguese take on fish and chips. They also examine how to make a salmon curry, and learn the formula for creating the perfect meat and potato pie.(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater's Simple Suppers
programme.desc: The food writer provides everyday cooking advice as he transforms classic recipes, including cottage pie and apple tart, by giving them a new twist. Nigel also visits allotments and gardens around the country, where he picks up the best fresh produce to prepare his take on beans on toast.(n)

programme.title: Luke Nguyen's Street Food Asia
programme.desc: The chef travels to countries around the continent to explore their thriving street food cultures, beginning with the first of two programmes from Saigon in Vietnam.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: The chef visits a five-star hotel in Madurai, Tamil Nadu, employing local housewives for genuine home-cooked dishes and samples chettinad chicken, a dish inspired by spices brought back from both East and West by merchants. In Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh, he meets India's first MasterChef winner, and marks the end of his culinary journey with a small gathering of friends at his bungalow to reveal the outcome of his search for the perfect curry.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen
programme.desc: Sam Witwicky wants his life back. After saving the universe of destruction in a battle between two warring races of robotic aliens, he wants to study at the University and spend the last moments before leaving with his girlfriend Mikaela. But avoiding his fate is not going to be an easy task to fulfill because an ambitious man of the government will put the world again in danger and start another round of the war between good and evil. The visions will return to Sams brain and he is not going to be able to ignore them. Despite he did not really want to, he finds himself back with his friends in the middle of a battle between the Autobots and Decepticons, and with the future of the whole universe in his hands(n)

programme.title: Next Day Air
programme.desc: An overnight shipment of drugs winds up being sent to the wrong recipient, prompting a frantic race to recover the package before the contents are discovered in this fast-paced crime comedy starring Donald Faison, Mos Def, and Mike Epps. When Brody (Epps) and Guch (Wood Harris) received package containing 10 kilos of grade-A cocaine, they assumed their financial woes were a thing of the past. The package was intended for their Brody and Guch's next-door neighbors, but the whacked-out courier (Donald Faison) delivered it to the wrong address. Recognizing the possibility for profit, the scheming duo plans to sell the cocaine to Brody's drug-dealing cousin (Omari Hardwick). Meanwhile Jesus (Cisco Reyes) and his girlfriend Chita (Yasmin Deliz), the intended recipients of the cocaine, set out to procure the package before notorious drug lord Bodego Diablo (Emilio Rivera) realizes it's gone missing. But Bodega is no slouch; he already knows the shipment was botched, and he's determined to get his drugs back no matter what the cost. Later, as Brody and Guch prepare to seal the deal that will set them up for life, the guns are drawn and the chaos begins(n)

programme.title: Beautiful Creatures
programme.desc: This epic romantic fantasy tells the story of Ethan, a young man who falls for Lena, a new girl in his small town, only to discover she comes from a mysterious family, all of whom all possess supernatural powers. Together, they team up to break a curse that casts Lena's entire future in doubt(n)

programme.title: The Quest
programme.desc: Martial arts movie star Jean-Claude Van Damme made his debut behind the camera as the director of this sweeping action drama. Van Damme stars as Chris Dubois, a clown pickpocket and Fagin-like leader of orphan thieves in 1925 New York City. Kidnapped by gun smugglers and then sold to pirate captain Lord Dobbs (Roger Moore), Chris eventually ends up the property of Khao (Aki Aleong), a master Asian kickboxer. His fighting skills win Chris a chance at a legendary contest, a gladiatorial showdown between champions of the world's many diverse combat styles in a Tibetan lost city. Along for the trip are the avaricious Dobbs, heavyweight boxing champ and fellow competitor Maxie (James Remar), and Carrie (Janet Gunn), a beautiful female reporter(n)

programme.desc: When a man discovers that his mother is going to marry the gym teacher who made his high school days a torturous experience he travels home, determined to prevent the wedding at all costs(n)

programme.title: Vice
programme.desc: Power to the President. Isobel Yeung reports from Turkey as citizens head to the polls in a nationwide referendum that grants President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan unprecedented power(n)

programme.title: The Words That Built America
programme.desc: Documents written by the Founding Fathers—the Declaration of Independence, the U.S. Constitution and the Bill of Rights—are read by living presidents and vice presidents, members of Congress, diplomats, celebrities and middle-school students from the United Nations International School. David McCullough narrates(n)

programme.title: What Women Want
programme.desc: Nick is a somewhat chauvinistic advertising hot shot, who has his life turned upside down when a strange accident enables him to hear what women think. At first all he wants to do is rid himself of this curse, until a wacky psychologist shows him that this could be used to his advantage!(n)

programme.title: Keeping Up With the Joneses
programme.desc: A couple inadvertently gets involved in an international plot after finding out that their new neighbours, while they seem to be perfectly normal, are secretly government spies(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Battle of the Bastards. Jon Snow and Ramsey Bolton finally come face-to-face in the battle for Winterfell(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The Winds of Winter. In the Season 6 finale, Tyrion counsels Daenerys on the upcoming campaign; Jon and Sansa discuss their future at Winterfell; and trials begin in King's Landing, though Cersei has other plans(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Dragonstone. In the Season 7 premiere, Jon organizes the defense of the North; Cersei seeks to even the odds; and Daenerys comes home(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Dragonstone. In the Season 7 premiere, Jon organizes the defense of the North; Cersei seeks to even the odds; and Daenerys comes home(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 1. Premiere of a four-part documentary series spotlighting the unlikely, but durable partnership between music producer Jimmy Iovine and rapper Dr. Dre. The opener follows Dre's story in Compton, Cal., and his fascination with dance music and Iovine's early days in Brooklyn(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Dragonstone. In the Season 7 premiere, Jon organizes the defense of the North; Cersei seeks to even the odds; and Daenerys comes home(n)

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen
programme.desc: Sam Witwicky wants his life back. After saving the universe of destruction in a battle between two warring races of robotic aliens, he wants to study at the University and spend the last moments before leaving with his girlfriend Mikaela. But avoiding his fate is not going to be an easy task to fulfill because an ambitious man of the government will put the world again in danger and start another round of the war between good and evil. The visions will return to Sams brain and he is not going to be able to ignore them. Despite he did not really want to, he finds himself back with his friends in the middle of a battle between the Autobots and Decepticons, and with the future of the whole universe in his hands(n)

programme.title: Next Day Air
programme.desc: An overnight shipment of drugs winds up being sent to the wrong recipient, prompting a frantic race to recover the package before the contents are discovered in this fast-paced crime comedy starring Donald Faison, Mos Def, and Mike Epps. When Brody (Epps) and Guch (Wood Harris) received package containing 10 kilos of grade-A cocaine, they assumed their financial woes were a thing of the past. The package was intended for their Brody and Guch's next-door neighbors, but the whacked-out courier (Donald Faison) delivered it to the wrong address. Recognizing the possibility for profit, the scheming duo plans to sell the cocaine to Brody's drug-dealing cousin (Omari Hardwick). Meanwhile Jesus (Cisco Reyes) and his girlfriend Chita (Yasmin Deliz), the intended recipients of the cocaine, set out to procure the package before notorious drug lord Bodego Diablo (Emilio Rivera) realizes it's gone missing. But Bodega is no slouch; he already knows the shipment was botched, and he's determined to get his drugs back no matter what the cost. Later, as Brody and Guch prepare to seal the deal that will set them up for life, the guns are drawn and the chaos begins(n)

programme.title: Beautiful Creatures
programme.desc: This epic romantic fantasy tells the story of Ethan, a young man who falls for Lena, a new girl in his small town, only to discover she comes from a mysterious family, all of whom all possess supernatural powers. Together, they team up to break a curse that casts Lena's entire future in doubt(n)

programme.title: The Quest
programme.desc: Martial arts movie star Jean-Claude Van Damme made his debut behind the camera as the director of this sweeping action drama. Van Damme stars as Chris Dubois, a clown pickpocket and Fagin-like leader of orphan thieves in 1925 New York City. Kidnapped by gun smugglers and then sold to pirate captain Lord Dobbs (Roger Moore), Chris eventually ends up the property of Khao (Aki Aleong), a master Asian kickboxer. His fighting skills win Chris a chance at a legendary contest, a gladiatorial showdown between champions of the world's many diverse combat styles in a Tibetan lost city. Along for the trip are the avaricious Dobbs, heavyweight boxing champ and fellow competitor Maxie (James Remar), and Carrie (Janet Gunn), a beautiful female reporter(n)

programme.title: Robin Hood: Men in Tights
programme.desc: A veteran of the Crusades brings together a ragtag group to do battle against an evil king, and gets help from a surprising source inside the royal castle, in this spoof of the Robin Hood legend(n)

programme.title: X-Men: Apocalypse
programme.desc: In this action-packed comic-book adventure set in the 1980s, the X-Men are forced to confront an ancient mutant called Apocalypse. After the resurrected villain recruits four superpowered followers, Professor X and his charges attempt to stop them(n)

programme.title: HBO First Look: 'War for the Planet of the Apes'
programme.desc: A look at "War for the Planet of the Apes," a 2017 thriller about an ape army's struggle against homo sapiens. The film stars Andy Serkis, Woody Harrelson and Steve Zahn, and is directed by Matt Reeves(n)

programme.title: Le Divorce
programme.desc: French vs. American social customs and behaviours are observed in a story about an American visiting her Frenchman-wed sister in Paris(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.desc: Vaccines. Vaccines are discussed(n)

programme.title: Risky Business
programme.desc: Risky Business is the film in which 19-year-old Tom Cruise dances around his living room in his underwear. He does this to celebrate the fact that his parents have left him alone while they go on vacation. Somewhere along the line, hooker Rebecca De Mornay, fleeing her vicious pimp, hides out in the Cruise manse. Things go from bad to worse to as Cruise inadvertently drives his father's Porsche into Lake Michigan and nearly scuttles his college recruitment interview(n)

programme.title: Loving
programme.desc: Jeff Nichols (Midnight Special, Mud) wrote and directed this biopic about Virginian interracial couple Richard and Mildred Loving (played by Joel Edgerton and Ruth Negga), who were sentenced to prison in 1958 for violating the state's laws against miscegenation. The Lovings decided to fight back, and their case led to a landmark Supreme Court decision that struck down laws prohibiting interracial marriage(n)

programme.title: Vice News Tonight
programme.desc: Episode 165. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children
programme.desc: After a family tragedy, a boy follows a series of clues that lead him to a mysterious orphanage on a remote Welsh island. There, he discovers a community of children with unusual abilities(n)

programme.title: Indignation
programme.desc: A young Jewish atheist attends college in 1951 Ohio, where he clashes with the school's established social order and his overbearing parents' hopes for his future. At the same time, he falls for an attractive, complicated classmate named Olivia(n)

programme.title: Speed Racer
programme.desc: A young race-car driver discovers that the world of auto racing is fixed in this live-action adaptation of the seminal Japanese anime. With the help of his family, he competes in a cross-country rally in order to expose those responsible(n)

programme.title: The Golden Compass
programme.desc: Nicole Kidman, Daniel Craig and Dakota Blue Richards star in Chris Weitz's family fantasy-adventure, based on the first book in Philip Pullman's His Dark Materials trilogy. Twelve-year-old orphan Lyra Belacqua lives in an Oxford college, where the staff do their best to push her enquiring mind down conventional educational routes. One day, having sneaked into a private meeting of the college's dons, Lyra learns of mysterious events taking place in the Arctic. Soon after, amid news of mysterious child abductors called the 'Gobblers', her best friend Roger (Ben Walker) vanishes. The fearless Lyra sets off, determined to rescue her playmate. But Lyra's is a parallel universe: one with Victorian-style technology; where people's souls take the visible form of character-suggesting animals; witches and talking, armoured polar bears rule the cold lands of the north; and an organisation called The Magisterium aims to assert its authority. Lyra's journey will prove a dangerous one that uncovers the terrible truth linking the Gobblers and the Arctic phenomenon she heard about in Oxford. Also starring Eva Green, and the voices of Freddie Highmore and Ian McKellan. Sadly, it now seems the following two films in the series are fated not to be made. Even so, this stands as a stirring, thoughtful family adventure that's reasonably true to Pullman's masterpiece(n)

programme.title: Get Smart
programme.desc: The spy spoof series gets the big screen treatment with this action comedy starring Steve Carell and Anne Hathaway. Agents 86, 99, and 23 lead Control against the evil entity KAOS(n)

programme.title: Mike and Dave Need Wedding Dates
programme.desc: Two hard-partying ladies see a viral video in which unruly brothers plead for dates for their sister's wedding in Hawaii, and decide to pose as the angels they're looking for in order to score a free trip in this incredibly raunchy comedy(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The Red Woman. In the Season 6 premiere, Sansa and Theon are on the run from Winterfell and Bolton's soldiers; Jaime delivers bad news to Cersei on his return from Dorne; Davos sends for help from the Wall; and Daenerys explains her identity to Khal Moro as Daario and Jorah continue their search for her, while Tyrion and Varys wander the eerily empty streets of Meereen(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Home. Bran trains under the guidance of the Three-Eyed Raven; Tommen gets advice from Jaime; Tyrion must get creative to find good news; Thorne has the support of the Night's Watch; Balon Greyjoy hears several proposals; Ramsay comes up with a new plan(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Oathbreaker. Bran glimpses a pivotal battle from his father's past; Daenerys learns what's in store for her at Vaes Dothrak; the High Sparrow discusses the importance of faith with Tommen; Arya crosses a threshold in her training to be No One; Varys comes up with a solution to a vexing problem; Ramsay gets a gift and news from the North(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Book of the Stranger. A disillusioned Jon is resolved to leave Castle Black, but a surprise reunion could give him a noble and urgent purpose following his reincarnation. Meanwhile, Tyrion pursues a deal with the masters of Slaver's Bay as he stalls for Daenerys' return; Theon tries to make amends for the past; Jorah and Daario realize the difficulty of their next move; and Cersei discusses Margaery's future with Olenna(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The Door. Sansa confronts Littlefinger about what he knew of Ramsay's intentions, though she keeps their meeting a secret when devising a strategy to retake Winterfell with Jon and Davos. Meanwhile, Arya gets an opportunity to prove herself, but is forced to relive a painful part of her past; Bran's vision transports him to a dangerous place; Tyrion pursues an unusual alliance, much to Varys' dismay; and Yara and Theon encounter resistance at the Kingsmoot(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Blood of My Blood. Hannah meets Sam's family; Arya mulls a difficult decision; Jaime confronts the High Sparrow(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The Broken Man. Jaime encounters a hero; the High Sparrow fixates on another prey; Arya hatches a new plan(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: No One. Brienne confronts Jaime during the siege at Riverrun; Cersei delivers a defiant response; Tyrion's plan starts to come together; Arya is presented with a new challenge(n)

programme.title: HBO First Look: 'War for the Planet of the Apes'
programme.desc: A look at "War for the Planet of the Apes," a 2017 thriller about an ape army's struggle against homo sapiens. The film stars Andy Serkis, Woody Harrelson and Steve Zahn, and is directed by Matt Reeves(n)

programme.title: Harold & Kumar Escape From Guantanamo Bay
programme.desc: Kal Penn and John Cho return in this outrageous and unrated sequel. The pot-smoking slacker pals are suspected of being terrorists---and have more irreverent misadventures with Neil Patrick Harris. Rob Corddry, Roger Bart, David Krumholtz, Eddie Kaye Thomas. Written and directed by Jon Hurwitz and Hayden Schlossberg(n)

programme.title: Krampus
programme.desc: While Santa Claus rewards good children with gifts on Christmas, Krampus, a beast-like creature with demonic appearance, seeks out naughty children and punishes them(n)

programme.title: Serendipity
programme.desc: John Cusack and Kate Beckinsale decide to let fate be their guide in this charming comedy about a man and woman who share an undeniable attraction when they meet, but concoct a series of experiments to determine if they are truly meant for each other. Jeremy Piven, Molly Shannon, John Corbett, Bridget Moynahan, Eugene Levy(n)

programme.title: Boiler Room
programme.desc: Energetic thriller in which an ambitious young man drops out of college and finds work in a 'boiler room', a hothouse of fast-talking, fast-living stocks salesmen. Initially seduced by the money and lifestyle, he soon becomes troubled by the unusual and aggressive behaviour of his new employers(n)

programme.title: Crossroads
programme.desc: Four years after they left school, three old pals team up for a road trip from Georgia to California. Mimi's got dreams of Hollywood, Kit's looking forward to seeing her beau, but Lucy wants escape...and maybe to find the mother she's never met(n)

programme.title: The Bodyguard
programme.desc: When beautiful superstar singer Rachel Marron (Houston) receives death threats, she hires Frank Farmer (Costner), the best bodyguard in the business. Haunted by a prior failure to stop an assassin's bullet, Farmer will let nothing and no one stop him from protecting his charge--until he breaks the cardinal rule of his profession by falling in love with his client(n)

programme.title: The Normal Heart
programme.desc: The onset of the HIV/AIDS crisis in the early 1980s spurs gay activists to raise awareness(n)

programme.title: Speed Racer
programme.desc: A young race-car driver discovers that the world of auto racing is fixed in this live-action adaptation of the seminal Japanese anime. With the help of his family, he competes in a cross-country rally in order to expose those responsible(n)

programme.title: War Dogs
programme.desc: In this comedy-drama based on true events, a down-on-his-luck massage therapist living in Miami (Miles Teller) teams up with a mercurial former classmate (Jonah Hill) to try to make it in the arms-dealing business. After starting small, the pals eventually get in over their heads when they land a 300-million-dollar contract with the U.S. government to supply weaponry for forces in Afghanistan. Directed by Todd Phillips(n)

programme.title: Crimson Peak
programme.desc: A mysterious stranger woos and transports a young woman to a crumbling dwelling atop a clay mountain, where she soon learns he has many secrets in the haunted mansion that will leave her fighting for her sanity and her very life(n)

programme.title: Be Cool
programme.desc: John Travolta is back as Mafia loanshark turned Hollywood Producer Chili Palmer in this sequel to GET SHORTY. This time, Chili finds himself mixing it up in the rough and tumble world of rock stars, pop divas, and hip hop gangstas when a new idea for a movie leads him into the music business. Will his wise guy attitude succeed in the ever-changing world of music or will more people just end up dead?(n)

programme.title: Shaft
programme.desc: Samuel L Jackson plays the eponymous hero in John Singleton's tough thriller, an ex-cop who sets out to nail Walter Wade Jnr., a killer using his rich kid connections to escape conviction. But as Shaft's net draws tighter, he has to contend with killers employed by a desperate Wade(n)

When Homer rescues a pig from certain death, little does he realise the full consequences of his action: Springfield will be isolated from the world by a gargantuan glass dome. It's the only way the government can prevent the pollution that he caused escaping to the outside world and creating a race of six-eyed squirrels. programme.title: Rendition
programme.desc: In this apprehensive thriller starred by Jake Gyllenhaal and Reese Whitherspoon, a CIA analyst questions his assignment after witnessing an unorthodox interrogation at a secret detention facility outside the US. After a terrorist bombing kills an American envoy in a foreign country, the investigation leads to an Egyptian who has been living in the United States for years and who is married to an American. He is sent to the country where the incident occurred, and his interrogation, which includes torture, is observed by an American CIA operative who questions whether to keep it going or to stop it(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Straight Outta Compton'
programme.desc: A look at "Straight Outta Compton," a 2015 drama that chronicles the history of the hip-hop group NWA in 1980s California. The film stars Jason Mitchell, Corey Hawkins, O'Shea Jackson Jr., Aldis Hodge and Neil Brown Jr., and is directed by F. Gary Gray(n)

programme.title: Speed
programme.desc: Fast-paced action adventure following a Los Angeles SWAT-team cop's attempts to foil the plans of a deranged bomber. The cop cheats his quarry out of one ransom, but, in response, the psycho contacts him with a warning about a bomb on a bus which will explode if the speed drops below 50mph. With the help of a female passenger, the cop attempts to navigate the bus around the crowded streets of LA while keeping its speed constant(n)

programme.title: The Conjuring
programme.desc: Paranormal investigators battle a malevolent entity that's haunting a family living in a remote farmhouse in this terrifying tale of the supernatural(n)

programme.title: Scream 3
programme.desc: Wes Craven's Scream (1996) was a half-parody/half-tribute to the first wave of slasher films of the 1970s and 1980s, and since most of them spawned a large number of sequels, it's only appropriate that Craven and screenwriter Kevin Williamson produced a third installment of their Scream franchise. Sidney Prescott (Neve Campbell), traumatized by the brutal murders of her friends, has left her hometown of Woodsboro and is working in California as a crisis intervention counselor. Meanwhile, "Stab," the novel by Gale Weathers (Courtney Cox Arquette), is spawning a series of successful horror films, and as Stab 3: Return to Woodsboro is being filmed in Los Angeles, a lunatic has gotten his hands on a copy of the script, and is murdering the characters in the same order that they die in the movie. But predicting who will die next is not as simple as it might seem, since the producers have circulated three different screenplays, with different endings. In addition to Campbell and Cox-Arquette, David Arquette returns from the first two films as less-than-bright "Dewey" Riley; new members of the cast include Parker Posey, Patrick Dempsey, Scott Foley, and Jenny McCarthy. Kevin Williamson wrote the original story, but the screenplay was penned by Ehren Kruger(n)

Along with a state trooper (Joel Edgerton), the pair go on a cross-country journey as they are hunted by federal agents, who believe Alton might be a threat to national security. programme.title: Demolition
programme.desc: Davis Mitchell (Jake Gyllenhaal) has a comfortable life as a Wall Street investment banker, but it's brought to an abrupt halt when his wife is killed in a car accident. As he struggles to move on from this tragedy, he reflects on the stagnant marriage he had with his late spouse. He also becomes obsessed with dismantling the machines surrounding him as a coping mechanism, and begins a relationship with a customer-service representative for a vending-machine company (Naomi Watts) after sending them multiple complaint letters. Director Jean-Marc Vallée directed this black dramedy, which made its world premiere at the 2015 Toronto International Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Under Siege
programme.desc: Casey Ryback is a former Navy SEAL captain who is now the cook aboard the USS Missouri. Everyone aboard is about to celebrate the birthday of Captain Adams. They've even hired a band led by William Strannix, and former playboy playmate Jordan Tate to jump out of a cake and dance. What Adams doesn't know is that he is in for a deadly surprise(n)

programme.title: Resident Evil
programme.desc: Milla Jovovich leads a team of commandos into the multi-national Umbrella Corporation's locked-down bunker, which is controlled by the main computer, The Red Queen. The unit is sealed because of a virus that gassed all the staff but, as Jovovich and her team discover, the virus has re-animated them. Now, as well as facing the computer's weaponry, they must tackle the living dead to prevent the virus escaping into the outside world. Paul W Anderson's horror thriller is based on the successful computer game(n)

programme.title: El Cantante

Jennifer Lopez, Anthony's real-life wife, costars as his spouse, and the cinematic sparks fly when the two are onscreen. Lopez also served as producer. programme.title: Soul Food
programme.desc: This hit domestic comedy-drama is based on George Tillman Jr's own family, is about the fortunes of an extended African-American family recalled through the eyes of young narrator Ahmad (Brandon Hammond). Ahmad's world revolves around his grandmother, Big Mama Joseph (Irma P. Hall) and her three daughters: workaholic lawyer Teri (Vanessa Williams), newlywed salon owner Bird (Nia Long), and Ahmad's housewife mom, Maxine (Vivica A. Fox). Each sister is in turmoil. Teri has lost patience for her husband Miles (Michael Beach), who wants to quit the law and take up music. Bird doesn't realise that her husband Lem (Mekhi Phifer) is about to be humiliated by her ex-boyfriend (Mel Jackson). And while Maxine's relationship with her husband Kenny (Jeffrey D. Sams) is going well, her relationship with her jealous sister Teri needs fixing. These conflicts boil over at Big Mama's traditional Sunday dinners, where the matriarch plays peacemaker. The ritual faces extinction, however, when Big Mama suffers a stroke - but Ahmad is waiting in the wings to take her place(n)

programme.title: Towelhead
programme.desc: Six Feet Under creator and American Beauty screenwriter Alan Ball makes his feature directorial debut with this screen adaptation of author Alicia Erian's controversial novel Towelhead. Jasira (Summer Bishil) is a 13-year-old Arab-American who's contending with the pains of adolescence when her life takes a sudden and unexpected turn. Sent to live with her stern Lebanese father, Rifat (Peter Macdissi), by her self-absorbed mother (Maria Bello), Jasira finds herself struggling to adjust to life in the suburbs while contending with racism and hypocrisy at every turn. Rifat lives in a modest, suburban Houston home next to racist reservist Mr. Vuoso (Aaron Eckhart) and meddling expectant mother Melina (Toni Collette). Adjusting to life in the suburbs isn't easy for young Jasira, though she tries her hardest to adapt to the unfamiliar environment by striking up casual conversations with her curious new neighbors. In the process, Jasira finds herself increasingly attracted to hormone-driven African-American teen Thomas (Eugene Jones). When Rifat finds out that his daughter's new boyfriend is black, he vehemently condemns the relationship. As America launches its initial invasion of Iraq, Jasira finds herself caught up in a potentially explosive situation that is only compounded by her raging hormones and the snooping of her pregnant, busybody neighbor(n)

Monk's disorder was triggered by the murder of his beloved wife, Trudy, which continues to haunt him as the only unsolved mystery in his career. programme.title: House of Wax
programme.desc: A bunch of college students are stranded in a small town where suffering for art takes on a whole new meaning in this tale of terror. Carly (Elisha Cuthbert) and her boyfriend, Wade (Jared Padalecki), have hit the road with a handful of their friends to attend a championship college football game; tagging along with them are Carly's bratty friend Paige (Paris Hilton, Carly's trouble-making twin brother Nick (Chad Michael Murray), and Blake (Robert Ri'chard), Paige's latest boy toy. While camping out for the night, the gang makes the mistake of getting on the wrong side of a mysterious local redneck, and the next morning they discover that Wade's car no longer works. As the others continue on to the big game, Carly and Wade make their way into the closest town, Ambrose, and discover it's all but deserted, except for a local tourist attraction, the House of Wax. However, it isn't long before they find out why the wax sculptures at the museum look so freakishly real, and discover a pair of murderous brothers are keen on making them part of the next exhibit. House of Wax is an in-name-only remake of the well-remembered 1953 3-D horror outing starring Vincent Price, which was in turn based on the 1933 picture Mystery of the Wax Museum(n)

programme.title: The Voice Kids

programme.title: The Voice Kids

Visiting her in a nursing home in London, Emma hopes that she may be able to give her the final piece of the puzzle. Last in the series.(n)

programme.desc: Piers travels to Gadsden Correctional Facility near Tallahassee in Florida, where he hears the story of Ashley Humphrey. As a 20-year-old in 2003, she pumped eight bullets into barmaid Sandee Rozzo - a crime for which she is now serving 25 years. Piers tries to understand how she came to commit the crime, wondering whether she was persuaded by her domineering and abusive husband - who was being accused of rape by the victim - or if she is simply a cold-blooded killer who came up with the plan herself.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Ventress goes in search of a bogus water board official who has been robbing the elderly, but ends up investigating a suspicious death linked to one of the burglaries. Meanwhile, Blaketon seeks to rectify a miscarriage of justice by reviving a pre-war darts tournament between the Aidensfield Arms and the White Lion, and Gina begins to get cold feet about her impending marriage to Phil. Rural drama, starring Derek Fowlds and William Simons.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Jenny and Dennis are forced to cut short their honeymoon in Spain, and Gina grows increasingly unhappy at the thought of having to give up her job as pub licensee to marry a policeman. Ventress creates a bad impression at the station, and a crooked travel agent finds a way of cashing in on local holiday-makers' absence, while Vernon organises a Bentley owners' rally at the hall. Sarah Tansey and Duncan Bell star.(n)

programme.desc: Jessica helps a teenage tennis player whose desire to win is being ruined by her domineering father and a tragedy in her past, leading to some complex emotional problems. Angela Lansbury stars.(n)

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: Charles investigates the fatal stabbing of a businessman in a pub car park - and gradually discovers the victim was not the upstanding pillar of the community he appeared to be. Jack Shepherd and Sharon Duce star.(n)

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: A local woman is killed when an experiment in biological warfare goes tragically wrong. Sam also falls victim to a potentially fatal illness as a result of the project. Foyle is forced to head into the most secretive and dangerous areas of wartime research, unearthing secrets that cannot be revealed even to the prime minister. Michael Kitchen stars, with Honeysuckle Weeks and Philip Franks.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: The glamorous Ruth Van Rydock contacts her old friend Jane Marple with a mystery - her sister Carrie Louise's study has been devastated by a suspicious fire. While Carrie Louise has the same cheerful outlook as ever, Ruth fears dark forces are at play at Stonygates, the home Carrie shares with her third husband, various relatives and a motley crew of young criminals, the latest subject of Carrie's philanthropic endeavours. But on the evening before a theatrical show is staged for their guests, one of whom is Miss Marple, an even more fascinating performance takes place before their very eyes - one where the final act is murder. Julia McKenzie stars, with guest appearances from Joan Collins, Penelope Wilton, Brian Cox, Maxine Peake, Alexei Sayle, Sarah Smart, Ian Ogilvy, Sean Hughes and Nigel Terry.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.sub-title: At Bertram's Hotel - Parts One & Two.
programme.desc: Feature-length drama. While holidaying at the plush Bertram's Hotel in London, Miss Marple is presented with a fresh challenge to her deductive powers when the reading of a will leads to a double murder. Geraldine McEwan stars as the elderly spinster with a nose for a mystery, with guest appearances by Peter Davison, Mica Paris and Francesca Annis.(n)

programme.title: The Booze Cruise III

Dave has business to do in Leeds, while Rob's just trying to avoid visiting Jackie's parents. Maurice hopes his friends will make the sober weekend enjoyable - unaware he'll be expected to complete a series of bizarre challenges if he's to claim his inheritance. With Neil Pearson, Mark Benton and Anne Reid.(n)

programme.desc: The evacuation of a central London hospital leads to the discovery of a tragic death. When Brooks and Devlin investigate, a suspect is arrested but the prosecutors (Ben Daniels and Freema Agyeman) face an uphill struggle building a case - so they team up with the detectives in a bid to gather more evidence. Patrick Malahide and Bill Paterson co-star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK

programme.title: The Perfect Murder

programme.title: Mom at Sixteen
programme.desc: The new girl in town is 16-year-old Jacey Jeffries (Danielle Panabaker), who lives with her divorced mother, Terry (Mercedes Ruehl), and her two siblings. A popular and highly intelligent student, not to mention a talented athlete, Jacey nonetheless seems to be harboring a private, profound sadness -- or at least that's the perception of her high-school guidance counselor, Donna Cooper (Jane Krakowski). Ultimately Donna figures out the truth behind Jacey's melancholia: her baby "brother" Charlie is actually her own son, born out of wedlock and raised by Jacey's overbearing mother in a misguided effort to shield her daughter from disgrace. Upon discovering Jacey's secret, Donna takes a special interest in the girl's welfare -- an interest undoubtedly fueled by the fact that Donna herself is unable to have children. The scenes taking place in the sex-education class have an air of reality often lacking in made-for-TV films, due to the fact that the young actors playing the students were encouraged to improvise their dialogue. Produced for the Lifetime cable network, Mom at Sixteen first aired on March 21, 2005(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with two sets of first-time buyers who could not be more different. Newlyweds Carl and Liz left their London lifestyle behind to look for a marital home in picturesque St Albans. Basketballing best buddies Jamie and Mike pooled their resources to buy in London's East End. But finding a home for the tall twosome was never going to be easy for Kirstie Allsopp. As well as looking back at their original search, the programme reveals how they have got on since.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp revisits Nadine and Toby, who bought and renovated their first home at the age of 26 and were in south-east London looking for their next big project. She also catches up with Wendy and Simon, who Phil Spencer helped to find a home in Derby, somewhere they could achieve the perfect work-life balance.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two sets of first-time buyers who are struggling to find homes. In Southampton, Jenny and Tom are keen to move out of their cramped rental property and into a house of their own, but they are facing fierce competition and a fast market. Meanwhile, in the New Forest, Georgie and Will are desperate to live together after seven years of being a couple. However, with Will working in Belgium during the week, the pair are finding suitable properties are snapped up before they have even had the chance to view them.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Training guru Steve Carlyle hosts the first party in York, but a sophisticated evening, complete with a butler, does nothing to boost his reputation as he competes to win the £1,000 prize at the end of the week.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Trevor Rooney, who leads tours of supposedly haunted sites in York, hosts the second dinner party in the city at a bric-a-brac warehouse. He also has several spooky surprises in store for his guests, including a magic show, a paranormal-themed menu and a ventriloquist's doll that spends the evening flirting with the female diners.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The third dinner party in York is hosted by Annie Albericci, who hopes to bring peace, love and harmony to the table with her festival-chic-themed evening. However, things go from bad to worse for Annie when the male guests find a racy photo of her.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nurse Yvonne McGill hosts the fourth dinner challenge in York and goes for a 1960s-themed party, including a game of Snog, Marry, Avoid? and a Beatles tribute band. Meanwhile, guest Steve reveals his celebrity crush.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Foodie Rebecca Ryan hosts the final dinner party in York, and hopes to impress her guests by throwing a Hollywood-themed evening of glitz and glamour, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to the Borgue Hotel in Dumfries and Galloway, which owners Vince and Shirley Barrett run with military precision. On arrival, guests Adam and Naomi are not impressed with the decor, while Ken and Elaine do not like the orange towels. Later, over dinner, the hosts reveal who wears the trousers in their relationship, before Ken's jokes go down like a lead balloon.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners visit the Allscott Mill B&B in Telford, Shropshire, on their second night, where hosts Ken and Elaine Purchase welcome their guests. On arrival, Shirely and Vince find fault with the lack of headroom in their lodgings, while Adam and Naomi are bemused by the absence of a toilet brush in their bathroom.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to Park House in Llandrindod Wells, Powys, where owners Ian and Joan Barr hope their colourful B&B will impress their guests. Adam and Naomi are wowed by the vibrant decor, but Ken and Elaine take issue with a dirty toilet brush.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Naomi and Adam Black welcome the contestants to East Thorne yurt retreat in Bude, Cornwall. They are pleased to discover it is Vince and Shirley's dream location, but Ken and Elaine don't share the same opinion. Later, the guests take part in an archery competition, and in the morning, are unimpressed with the DIY breakfast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The rival owners meet for the final time on the last day of the competition to find out what they've been paid and settle some scores. Hosting skills, breakfasts, facilities and two toilet brush gripes are aired before the cash is counted and the winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Theatre enthusiast Jay Coleman hosts the first party in Newport, Gwent, putting on a dramatic evening with an international menu, in the hope of winning the £1,000 prize at the end of the week.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Peace activist Pippa Bartolotti hosts the second of the week's dinner parties in Newport, Gwent, serving up a menu of locally sourced vegetarian food and hoping to entertain her guests by indulging in a spot of fortune-telling. However, a talkative Duncan Powell threatens to dominate proceedings.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Radio journalist Emma Jones hosts the third dinner party in Newport, Gwent, serving up an American-themed menu of crab cakes and pulled pork, and the 23-year-old tries to boost her chances of taking home the prize money with a cheerleading session.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Housewife Sarah Kinnear hosts the fourth dinner party in Newport, Gwent, and her guests are encouraged to attend wearing `Welsh icon' attire. However, she takes a gamble when she engages in a lively dinner-table debate with Duncan and Pippa.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Recruitment boss Duncan Powell hosts the final dinner party in Newport, Gwent, and hopes his Hawaiian-themed evening will impress his guests enough to win the prize. Unfortunately for him, prawn brains and sea bass bones harm his chances of success, so the confident cook tries to rescue the evening with a lemon posset.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Documentary capturing the behaviour of the animals at Chester Zoo. An outbreak of disease in the penguin colony leaves chick Munch fighting for his life. Sulawesi macaque Lisa gives birth and dad Mamassa is providing pretty useless, so older brother Beaker steps in to help with the babysitting. Andean spectacled bear Bernie is determined to woo Lima when she enters her short window of fertility, and young male tortoise Football muscles in on 71-year-old Bert's harem of females.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.sub-title: Are You Right There, Father Ted?.
programme.desc: The priest offends Craggy Island's Chinese community and pulls out all the stops to convince them that he is not racist - but his efforts end in disaster. Sitcom, starring Dermot Morgan, Ardal O'Hanlon, Frank Kelly and Pauline McLynn, with Ozzie Yue.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.sub-title: World Para Athletics Championships London 2017: Day Three.
programme.desc: Arthur Williams, Sophie Morgan and Lee McKenzie present concluding coverage of the evening session on day three of the Championships, which takes place at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park. Among the finals scheduled to take place tonight are the women's T42 100m and T35 200m, as well as the men's T13 and T44 100m, the T54 1500m, and the F35 shot put. With expert analysis from Stef Reid, Danny Crates, David Weir, and Liam Malone.(n)

programme.title: Micky Flanagan's Out Out Tour
programme.desc: A performance by the comedian from his sold-out nationwide tour. He tells the story of his upbringing in London's East End and his rise to fame, making observations about the British class system along the way.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Sarah, 35, arrives at King's College Hospital concerned that a brain tumour she first had as a teenager has returned. Helen, 47, is worried about her baby son James, who was born with a hole in his heart and one kidney, and has been vomiting since the morning, while 28-year-old Wayne seeks treatment for knife wounds to his leg after he tried to stop someone stealing his girlfriend's phone.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef tries to change the fortunes of Finn McCool's, a traditional Irish pub in the Hamptons, New York. The chances of the establishment becoming a success are being ruined by the owner Buddy Mazzio's two sons, bartender Jason and chef Brian, who are constantly fighting with each other, prompting Gordon to have a heart-to-heart with the family.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef tries to change the fortunes of the Old Stone Mill restaurant in Tuckahoe, New York, which is struggling to attract customers, leading to debts of nearly $1million. Gordon feels the owner is more interested in his own appearance than how his food tastes and a screaming match ensues.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Sarah, 35, arrives at King's College Hospital concerned that a brain tumour she first had as a teenager has returned. Helen, 47, is worried about her baby son James, who was born with a hole in his heart and one kidney, and has been vomiting since the morning, while 28-year-old Wayne seeks treatment for knife wounds to his leg after he tried to stop someone stealing his girlfriend's phone.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr returns with the topical comedy panel show, welcoming back team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson, who are joined by guests including comedians Jack Dee and Rob Beckett, radio presenter Gemma Cairney and Jamie Laing from Made in Chelsea. As usual, the panellists discuss and dissect the events that have set the British public's chins wagging over the past week.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps Ali Harris and Steve Ashby from Poole to fulfil their dream of retiring to Italy to run a very English B&B, with the couple having a budget of £100,000.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A boxer dog is brought in with extensive injuries to its pelvis and hind legs from a road accident. Pioneering surgeon Noel Fitzpatrick considers a stem-cell scaffolding procedure - but there are significant risks attached. He and his team also help different animals with broken legs, including hedgehogs, and a kitten that has had an accident at home.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at the Shelley Guest House in Aberystwyth, where its husband-and-wife owners hope to prove that their establishment offers the best value for money by providing their guests with an old-school form of entertainment, some Spanish cuisine and a monumental continental breakfast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests travel to the five-star Ixworth House in Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk, where hosts John and Sharyn Snell are quietly confident their establishment will impress. John reveals his hidden talents at dinner, but his performance at breakfast the next morning does not go down well with all of the fellow B&B owners.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: In York, part-time panto dame Graham Smith runs the Georgian House & Mews, and takes his guests back in time with a Nordic test of strength. At supper, Hazel has romance on her mind, but the guests are left to fend for themselves at breakfast - until Graham makes a show-stopping appearance.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to the George Hotel in Orton, Cumbria, for the fourth visit of the day. Owner Hazel McAleese organises a fishing trip as the afternoon activity, during which one of the guests decides to use the opportunity to give everyone a lesson in innuendo.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants featured throughout the contest reunite to revisit the highs and lows of their various stays, and as the B&B owners confront their critics face to face, they discover what the rival parties really thought of the quality of service they encountered. After the deliberations are over, the winning guest house is announced.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin searches Lot-et-Garonne in the south west of France for Karen Wright and Philip Johnston, who dream of retiring to the country. They have £100,000, but that isn't just for them. The property needs to be large enough for their five dogs - and to accommodate even more as they have a dream of fostering rescue pooches.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Property expert Jasmine Harman helps Steph Fessey and Andy Wynn from Hampshire search for a property on Portugal's Silver Coast within a budget of £100,000. The couple are looking for a house with a spacious garden for when their children and grandchildren visit, as well as views of the countryside.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team search for the remains of a Norman castle in Dundrum, Co Down, one of Northern Ireland's most picturesque counties, exploring a territory established by renegade knight John de Courcy in the 12th century against the orders of King John. The castle was later rebuilt, and much of its replacement is still standing, but the experts are convinced that some of what remains dates from de Courcy's time - and discover that it may go back even further.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team try to piece together the complete picture of the Manor of the More, a once impressive structure masterminded by Henry VIII's right-hand man, Cardinal Wolsey. The palace had been forgotten about until the 1950s, when a group of pupils at Northwood School in Hertfordshire discovered its remains beneath a playing field. One of them joins the team on an adventure of discovery, observing remains dating back to the 16th century.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and mechanic Fuzz Townshend head to Plymouth to rescue a 25-year-old example of the world's bestselling two-seater sports car - the Mazda MX5.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Expats Dave and Sue arrive at the surgery after a 500-mile trip from France to bring their border collie Kaspar, who has a leg pain that is proving hard to diagnose. An eight-year-old pug needs surgery on its elbow, and an Egyptian Mau cat is rushed into Fitzpatrick's after fracturing its knee in a fall from a second-floor balcony. Noel goes ahead with surgery on the complex fracture, but if there are any complications the kitten may face amputation.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: More than a decade ago, Kevin McCloud visited Brighton to meet a co-operative of 10 families, including former travellers and single parents, who were building their own and each other's homes, with the promise that the council would allow them to live in the finished properties at a reduced rent. For two years they laboured, balancing a 30-hour week with various other commitments. Now the presenter returns to see whether the houses, and the community that built them, have stood the test of time.(n)

programme.title: Dunkirk: The New Evidence
programme.desc: Documentary examining the famous Second World War evacuation of Allied soldiers - codenamed Operation Dynamo - from the beaches of Dunkirk, France, between May 26 and June 4, 1940. Recently released Ministry of Defence files reveal that, far from being absent as many historians have believed, the RAF was suffering massive losses supporting the evacuation. Operating at high altitude and deep inside France, RAF planes were halting the bulk of Luftwaffe bombers before they could reach the beaches. The files also reveal that the famous Spitfire took flight for the first time during the mission, and the agile fighter was a spectacular success.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Aaron, 31, is rushed to St George's after overturning his car onto metal railings during a high-speed collision. He has a serious laceration to his face where a spiked railing narrowly missed his eye socket. Cameras also follow Fiona, 65, who is rushed to the hospital after falling over in a restaurant and cutting her knee during her friend Evelyn's 70th birthday party.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: The challenges faced by emergency services on the roads, revealing how new technology can detect people driving under the influence of drugs, leading to a rise in convictions. A woman is found to be over the limit while driving only a few streets away from her home. Emergency services personnel reveal the problems they have when dealing with elderly motorists who may no longer be able to drive safely, and how responding to an incident can have lasting repercussions.(n)

programme.title: Arrow

programme.title: The Force: Manchester
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of Greater Manchester Police, which is England's second-largest force and is responsible for protecting 2.7 million people.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor tours the rooms, restaurants and bars where the rich and famous have lived, died and fallen in love, checking in to Bastille's L'Hotel in Paris where Oscar Wilde spent his last days. He travels to New York's Chelsea Hotel, where long-term residents included Mark Twain, Stanley Kubrick, Edith Piaf, Sid Vicious and Robert Mapplethorpe. Richard also heads to the Dorchester in London's Mayfair, where Britt Ekland shares her memories of meeting and falling for Peter Sellers there in 1964.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor uncovers the gossip, intrigue and scandal lurking behind the closed doors of some of the world's most famous rooms and suites. He visits the Chateau Marmont on Hollywood's Sunset Boulevard, where Howard Hughes famously holed up in the penthouse, Jean Harlow and Clark Gable carried out a torrid affair and Lindsay Lohan was recently temporarily banned for not paying a bill. In New York, he talks to former mobster Louis Ferrante about a robbery at the Pierre Hotel in 1972 in which cash and jewellery worth $10million was stolen.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor learns what it means to be treated like a VIP in some of the world's finest hotels. He heads to the Harlequin Suite at London's Dorchester, where Elizabeth Taylor had a pink marbled bathroom installed. He also visits Paris's Le Meurice, the place Salvador Dali returned to every year for 30 years. He meets the surrealist artist's muse Amanda Lear, who talks about his antics, as well as how his legacy is celebrated in the hotel today. In America, Richard gets a true taste of the lifestyle of the megarich when he orders the $5,000 fleurburger at the Mandalay Bay Hotel in Las Vegas.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: Brixham hosts its annual Pirate Festival, paying tribute to Devon's colourful maritime history, while fisherman Nathan sets off in search of a lucrative catch.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: The grumpy medic is convinced a man with serious lung damage and a skin rash has been poisoned by heavy metals. He wonders whether the patient's wife is involved - though the team contend that the tests disprove the diagnosis. Meanwhile, House tires of having Wilson stay with him. Hugh Laurie and Robert Sean Leonard star.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: The doctors struggle to find out why a girl suffers an allergic reaction in a sterile room after a heart transplant, until her boyfriend admits sneaking in for a late-night visit. After questioning him closely, House believes medication being taken by her partner could be the cause, but soon realises her problem is far more complicated. Michelle Trachtenberg guest stars.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: A boy's symptoms remind House of a previous patient, who died before her condition could be diagnosed. Hugh Laurie plays the grumpy medic.(n)

Despite trailing the Broncos 10-0 at the end of the first quarter, the Redskins battled back in spectacular fashion, scoring 35 unanswered points in the second quarter alone, as they went on to a secure a memorable 42-10 victory.(n)

programme.title: NFL: America's Game
programme.desc: A look back at Dallas Cowboys' 1993 Super Bowl triumph against Buffalo Bills at the Georgia Dome in Atlanta, Georgia. This match represented the first time in history that the same teams faced each other in the showpiece match in two consecutive years, while the Cowboys' 30-13 victory meant they tied the Pittsburgh Steelers and the San Francisco 49ers for most Super Bowl wins, as they claimed their fourth trophy.(n)

programme.title: The Pink Panther
programme.desc: The world's most inept police detective, Inspector Clouseau, heads off to Switzerland in search of a suave jewel thief who has purloined a priceless diamond from a princess - but the bumbling officer's every ruse to foil the crime ends in chaos, not least when he is framed for the robbery himself. Blake Edwards' comedy, starring Peter Sellers, David Niven, Capucine, Robert Wagner and Claudia Cardinale.(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show
programme.desc: Clips from the UK and US Top Ten show you the best of what's on offer on the big screen.(n)

programme.title: Starsky & Hutch
programme.desc: Two mismatched detectives are forced to work together for the first time to track down a crime kingpin who has introduced a new, undetectable narcotic to the streets - but they struggle to get along. Comedy spoofing the 1970s cop show, starring Ben Stiller, Owen Wilson, Snoop Dogg, Vince Vaughn and Juliette Lewis.(n)

programme.title: Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby
programme.desc: A Nascar racing champion has everything he could want - until an arrogant French rival seizes the title from him, and his wife runs off with his best friend. Forced to move back in with his mother, the downhearted driver turns to his estranged father for help rebuilding his shattered self-confidence. Comedy, starring Will Ferrell, John C Reilly and Sacha Baron Cohen.(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show
programme.desc: Clips from the UK and US Top Ten show you the best of what's on offer on the big screen.(n)

programme.title: Zoolander
programme.desc: Dim male model Derek Zoolander is stunned to find his career going downhill thanks to the arrival of an equally vacuous rival - but fails to realise he is merely a pawn in a dangerous game of international espionage and world domination. Comedy, starring Ben Stiller, Owen Wilson, Will Ferrell, Milla Jovovich, Christine Taylor and David Duchovny.(n)

programme.title: Zoolander 2
programme.desc: A dim-witted supermodel must step back into the spotlight and save the day when someone starts murdering pop stars. Comedy sequel, starring Ben Stiller and Owen Wilson.(n)

programme.title: Daddy's Home
programme.desc: A mild-mannered man hopes for his wife's two children to view him as their father. His dreams of perfect family life are threatened by the return of their biological father, a charismatic, motorcycle-riding tough guy, and he pulls out all the stops to prove to his stepchildren that he can be just as cool. Comedy, starring Will Ferrell and Mark Wahlberg.(n)

programme.title: Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby
programme.desc: A Nascar racing champion has everything he could want - until an arrogant French rival seizes the title from him, and his wife runs off with his best friend. Forced to move back in with his mother, the downhearted driver turns to his estranged father for help rebuilding his shattered self-confidence. Comedy, starring Will Ferrell, John C Reilly and Sacha Baron Cohen.(n)

Comedy, starring Ben Stiller, Owen Wilson, Will Ferrell, Milla Jovovich, Christine Taylor and David Duchovny.(n)

programme.title: Zoolander 2

programme.title: Daddy's Home
